Use sequin yarn to crochet a shimmery necklace! It’s actually just a one row project with “beads” formed by crocheting bobbles. It’s a perfect gift idea!
Special Stitch
bobble = yarn over, insert hook in indicated chain, yarn over, draw up a loop, yarn over and pull through 2 loops on hook, [yarn over, insert hook in same chain, yarn over, draw up a loop, yarn over and pull through 2 loops on hook] 4 times (6 loops on hook), yarn over and pull through all 6 loops on hook.
NECKLACE (make 1 in each color)
Ch 4.
Row 1: Bobble in 4th ch from hook, *ch 5, bobble in 4th ch from hook; repeat from * 84 times or to desired length; join with slip st in bottom of first bobble—86 bobbles. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Crochet Thread Classic™ 10 (350 yds/320 m) Aqua (154-0450) 1 ball
Size No. 2 (1.5 mm) steel crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 2" [5 cm] diameter x 2½" [6.5 cm] long.
gauge: 36 dc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Join each rnd with sl st to first st.
• Ch-3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Large Circle (make 2)
Ch 4. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd:  11 dc in 4th ch from hook. 
Join. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 2 dc 
in each dc around. Join. 24 dc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 3. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc 
in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 
2 dc in last dc. Join. 36 dc.
4th rnd:  Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2). 
*Skip next dc. 1 dc in each of next 
2 dc. Ch 2. Rep from * to last 2 dc. 
Skip next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join. 
48 sts.
5th rnd:  *5 dc in next ch-2 sp. Sl st 
in next dc. Rep from * around. Join. 
Fasten off.
Small Circle (make 2)
Ch 4.
1st rnd:  11 dc in 4th ch from hook. 
Join. 12 dc.
Fasten off.
Using a 7mm jump ring, connect 
the Large Circle and Small Circle. 
Attach fish hook ear wire to top of 
Small Circle.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 401 Orchid Pink A and 661 Frosty Green B
Susan Bates® Steel Crochet Hook: 1.5mm [US 7 steel]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Earring measures approximately 1” (2.5 cm) x 1¼” (3.2 cm)
gauge: 3 sts = .25” (6.35 mm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
EARRINGS 
Rosebud (Make 2)
With A, ch 9.
Row 1 (Right Side): 5 dc in 4th ch from hook, 5 dc in each remaining ch across, slip st in top of dc adjacent to last dc made (Rosebud formed). Fasten off and weave in ends.
Leaf (Make 2)
With B, ch 5.
Round 1: Slip st in first ch to form ring, *ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, (dc, slip st) in ring; repeat from * 4 times, slip st in joining slip st. Fasten off and weave in ends.
FINISHING
To assemble, lay 1 Rosebud and 1 Leaf, wrong sides together. Sew or glue (optional) Rosebud and Leaf together. Weave in ends. Sew assembled Rosebud and Leaf onto earring wire. Optional: If using a post finding, glue or sew assembled Rosebud and Leaf to post.

materials: Susan Bates® Steelite® Crochet Hook: 1.65mm [US 7 steel hook]
four 6mm brown and tan spectra glass beads
two 8mm brown and tan spectra glass beads
six 4mm lab topaz gem cut glass beads
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Earring measures 2½" long x 1¼" wide (6.5 x 3 cm), including earwire and large dangle.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
What you will need:
RED HEART® Classic Dangling Star Earrings
Add dangling beads to these stunning crocheted earrings and give them extra appeal! Need a certain color for your outfit? Check out all the colors available in size 10 crochet thread.

Special Stitches
beg-pop (beginning popcorn) = Ch 2 (counts as dc), 3 dc in ring, drop loop from hook, insert hook from front to back in top of the beginning ch, place dropped loop back on hook and draw through.
popcorn = Work 4 dc in ring, drop loop from hook, insert hook from front to back in first dc of 4-dc group, place dropped loop back on hook and draw through.

Special Technique
Adjustable-ring method = Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail firmly between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work stitches of first round in the ring, working over both strands (the tail and the ring). After the first round of stitches is worked, pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.

EARRING Flower (make 2)
Make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Beg-pop in ring, [ch 2, popcorn in ring] 5 times, ch 2; join with slip st in first popcorn—6 popcorns and 6 ch-2 spaces. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, *(hdc, dc, ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook (point made), ch 1, dc, hdc) in next ch-2 space, slip st in next popcorn; repeat from * around ending with last slip st in beginning ch—6 points. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block and lightly starch as needed. With pliers, open loop of each earwire, insert through any point on each flower, then close earwire.

Large Dangle (make 2) 
Place an 8mm bead on a headpin, then place a 4mm bead on the headpin. Leaving ½" (1.5 cm) above last bead, use wire cutter to cut off unused length of headpin. Insert headpin through point directly opposite earwire and pinch loop closed with pliers.

Small Dangle (make 4)
Make same as large dangle with 6mm beads in place of 8mm beads. Insert headpin through point on each side of large dangle and pinch loops closed with pliers.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 8 yards each 01 White and 12 Black
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 1.5mm [US-7 Steel Hook]
Sequins of various sizes & shapes in any desired colors
Small amount of fiber fill stuffing
measurements: Earrings measure 1¾” (4.5 cm) tall and 17⁄16” (3.5 cm) wide.
gauge: Rounds 1-4 = 7⁄8” (2 cm). Gauge is not critical, fabric needs to be firm.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Day of the Dead 
Earrings
Whether you’re observing the Day of the Dead 
or Halloween, the skulls on these earrings 
add just the right touch. The findings for 
constructing the earrings are as close as your 
local craft store.

3 sc in next st, sc next 2 sts, sc2tog over next 
2 sts, sc next 3 sts, 2 sc next st, [sc in next 5 
sts, 2 sc in next st] 2 times; join with slip st in 
first sc – 50 sc and 2 sc2tog.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Embellish Skulls
Using photo as a guide, embroider mouths and 
noses on skulls with second color. To make 
eyes, sew sequins in place with one seed 
bead in center of each sequin with beading 
thread and needle to make eyes.
Using second color, sew 2 skulls Wrong Sides 
together with whipstitch around edges. Lightly 
stuff and sew jump ring firmly in place at top 
of skull. Use pliers to connect earring wires to 
jump ring.

EARRINGS
Skull (Make 2 in each color)
Round 1: Starting with first color, make an 
adjustable slip knot, ch 2, work 7 sc in 2nd 
ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc; pull 
beginning yarn tail to close center – 7 sc.

Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join 
with slip st in first sc – 14 sc.

Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 7 
times; join with slip st in first sc – 21 sc.

Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next 
st] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc – 28 sc.

Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next 
st] 2 times, sc in next 4 sts, (sc, ch 1, dc) in 
next st, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 
st, (dc, ch 1, sc) in next st, sc next 2 sts, 2 
sc next st, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 2 
times; join with slip st in first sc – 30 sc, 6 dc 
and 2 ch-1 spaces.

Round 6: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next 
st] 2 times, sc next 3 sts, sc2tog over next 2 
sts, sc in ch-1, (sc, hdc, dc) in next st, dc in 
next 4 sts, (dc, hdc, sc) next st, sc next ch-1, 
sc2tog over next 2 sts, sc next 2 sts, 2 sc next 
st, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 2 times; 
join with slip st in first sc – 35 sc, 2 sc2tog, 2 
hdc and 6 dc.

Round 7: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next 
st] 2 times, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog over next 2 
sts, sc next 2 sts, 3 sc next st, sc in next 4 sts.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Crochet Thread Classic™ 10 (Colors: 300 yds/274.32 m)
Size U.S. 9 [1.25 mm] Susan Bates® steel crochet hook
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Rose: Approx ¾" [2 cm] diameter, excluding earring wire. Cactus: Approx 1" [2.5 cm] tall, excluding earring wire.
gauge: Not specified
instructions:
Note: Cactus worked in continuous rnds top down.
Rose
See Diagram on page 2.
With B, ch 30.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 2. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep * to end of chain. Turn. 14 ch-2 sps.
2nd row: Ch 2. *(Sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc. Sl st) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * in each ch-2 sp to end of row. Leave last sc unworked. 14 petals. Fasten off, leaving long end.
Coil into a rose, having fasten off tail at center of Rose. Secure Rose with stitching through all thicknesses.
Cactus
See Diagram on page 2.
With A, ch 2. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 scbl in each sc around.
4th to 11th rnds: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Stuff lightly.
12th rnd:  (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join with sl st to first st. 6 sts. Fasten off leaving long tail. Weave tail through rem 6 sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Cactus Arms (Make 2)
See Diagram.
With A, ch 2. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 6 sc. 
3rd rnd: 1 scbl in each sc around.
4th rnd: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off leaving long tail.
Stitch one arm on Left side of Cactus between rows 9 and 10. Stitch the second arm on Right side of Cactus between rnds 7 and 8. Stitch arms so that they sit against Cactus pointing up.
Top Flower 
See Diagram.
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: (Sl st. 1 dc) 6 times in 2nd ch from hook.
Fasten off with long tail for sewing. Stitch to top of Cactus at an angle.
FINISHING
Rose: Attach first jump ring to top of a petal at WS of Rose. Attach second jump ring to first jump ring. Attach third jump ring to second jump ring and to earring wire.
Cactus: Attach jump ring to top behind Flower. Attach second jump ring to first jump ring. Attach third jump ring to second jump ring and to earring wire.

Halloween Motif Necklace
Halloween lovers of all ages will enjoy this crocheted necklace! Choose from bats, witches and pumpkins to create colorful appliques that celebrate the season.
Finishing
Using embroidery floss, attach orange beads to Head as shown in photo. Using long ends, sew Head between Wings. Using long ends, sew assembled Bat to center of Necklace.
Pumpkin (make 2)
With D, ch 2.
Row 1: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, ch 1, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: 2 sc in each sc across, ch 1, turn—6 sc.
Row 3: [Sc2tog in next 3 sts] 2 times, ch 1, turn—2 sc.
Row 4: Skip 1 sc, slip st in next st. Fasten off.
Finishing
Using embroidery floss and French knots (see illustration), embroider eyes and nose as shown in photo. Using embroidery floss and straight stitches embroider mouth as shown in photo. Using long ends, sew Pumpkin in place on Necklace as shown in photo. Using glowworm and satin stitch (see illustration), embroider stem.
Finished Size: 21” (53.3 cm) long
Note: Leave long end at beginning and end of each piece to be used to attach pieces to necklace.
Special Stitches
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
NECKLACE
With A, ch 80.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 20 chs, hdc in next 6 chs, 2 hdc in next ch, hdc in next 10 chs, 2 hdc in next 2 chs, hdc in next 10 chs, 2 hdc in next ch, hdc in next 6 chs, sc in next 22 chs, ch 1, turn¬—83 sts.
Row 2: *Slip st in next st, skip 1 st, 3 sc in next st, repeat from * across, ch 3, slip st in base of row 1 for button hole. Fasten off.
Finishing
With A, sew button on opposite side of necklace.
Bat
Wings (make 2)
With B, ch 7.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc2tog in next 2 chs, [ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next ch) twice, slip st in last ch. Fasten off.
Head
With B, ch 4.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 2 chs, ch 1, turn.
Row 2: Sc in next 2 sc, ch 2, turn.
Row 3: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 2 sc. Fasten off.
Designed By Michele Wilcox

Witch
Face (make 2)
With C, ch 2.
Row 1: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, ch 1, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Sc in next sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last sc. Fasten off.
Hat (make 2)
With B, ch 7.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, sc2tog in next 2 chs, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, evenly space 3 slip sts across bottom of Hat, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook. Fasten off.
Finishing
Using long ends, sew 1 Face under each Hat. Using embroidery floss and French knots (see illustration), embroider eyes as shown in photo. Using embroidery floss and straight stitches, embroider nose and mouth as shown in photo. Using long ends, sew Witch in place on Necklace as shown in photo.
ABBREVIATIONS
ch = chain; cm = centimeter; dc = double crochet; hdc = half double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified; * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.

materials: RED HEART® Metallic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball of 410S Silver/Silver
66 glass E-beads (approximately 10g) in shades of blue (more if making a longer Necklace loop)
big eye beading needle or dental floss threader
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Necklace measures approximately 40" (102 cm) around loop.
gauge: 33 chains in pattern = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Using big eye beading needle or dental floss threader, string beads onto the end of the thread. Push the beads far enough down the thread to leave a 6" (15 cm) beginning tail, then make a slip knot to create the working loop. Round 1: [Ch 4, bdch] 66 times. Without twisting Necklace, slip st in each of first 4 chs at beginning of Necklace to join ends. Fasten off and weave in both ends to secure.

Special Stitch
Beaded Chain (bdch) = Slide bead up next to working loop on hook (see photo 1), then yarn over and pull through loop on hook, capturing bead on back bar of chain stitch (see photo 2).

Notes
1. If a longer Necklace is desired, or to make multiple strands, string extra beads on the ball of thread.
2. Necklace is created by crocheting a length of alternating regular and beaded chain stitches, then fastening the ends together with slip stitches and weaving in the ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 226 Natural
1 box Crystazzi Round Pearl Matte Rose 6mm glass pearl beads in ivory
measurements: Pendant measures 17⁄8” x 2¼” (4.8 x 5.7 cm). Earring measures 1” x 1¼” (2.5 x 3.2 cm). Necklace measures 17” (43 cm) long.
gauge: Earring=1” (2.5 cm) in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com ©2012 Coats & Clark
EARRING (Make 2)
Ch 12, join with slip st in first ch to make ring.
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as first tr), work 24 tr in ring; join, ch 10 for earring wire loop, skip next tr, slip st in next tr – 25 tr. Fasten off. Starch if desired.
FINISHING
With needle nosed pliers, open jump ring, insert in center top of Large Circle of Pendant, close over completed necklace. With beading needle threaded with ivory sewing thread, sew a single pearl to bottom center of each earring, using a seed bead as anchor. With needle nosed pliers, open fishhook earring wires, close over each earring’s ch-10 loop.
NOTE: All circles are worked with Right Side facing. Always join with slip st in first st.
NECKLACE
Insert first end of beading wire through a crimp, thread through one end of barrel clasp, and back through crimp; pinch crimp shut firmly with pliers; trim wire end if necessary. String enough ivory glass pearls onto beading wire to make a 17” (43 cm) strand (or any length desired); trim wire to 2” (5 cm) past the last bead, insert end through a crimp, through the second end of barrel clasp, and back through crimp; pinch crimp shut firmly with pliers; trim wire end if necessary.
Pendant
Large Circle
Ch 5 (first ch-4 counts as first tr), work 17 tr in 5th ch from hook; join – 18 tr. Fasten off.
Medium Circle
Ch 4 (first ch-3 counts as first dc), work 17 dc in 4th ch from hook; join – 18 dc. Fasten off, leaving long sewing end.
Small Circle
Ch 3, work 18 hdc in third ch from hook; join – 18 hdc. Fasten off, leaving long sewing end.
Assembly
Using long sewing end on Medium Circle, sew Medium Circle to Large Circle. Using long sewing end on Small Circle, sew Small Circle to Medium Circle opposite first joining. Weave in all ends. Starch if desired.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver® – 1 skein 512 Turqua or 254 Pumpkin or 3620 Glowworm or 3939 Blacklight or color of your choice
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook – 5.5 mm [US I-9]
measurements: Bracelet can measure any desired length. We recommend making bracelets between 6" [15 cm] and 9" [23 cm] long.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
Make a slip knot and place it on the hook. Make chain (ch) stitches until piece measures desired length for bracelet.
Row 1: Single crochet (sc) in second ch from hook, sc in next ch, double crochet (dc) in next ch, *sc in each of next 2 ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * to end.
Button Loop: Ch 5, slip stitch in ch at base of last dc made.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew button to end of bracelet opposite the button loop. Using yarn needle, weave in yarn tails.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Fashion Crochet Thread”, Size 5: 1 ball 0310C Copper Mist.
OR AUNT LYDIA’S® “Fashion Crochet Thread” Size 3: 1 ball 0310 Copper Mist
Crochet Hook: 2.75 mm [US C-2] or 3.25 mm [US D-3]
abbreviations: CQ (curlicue) = Ch the number of times indicated by the number following the CQ, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across.
Picot = Ch 3, slip st in 3rd ch from hook.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
+ and ++ = work whatever is between the + and ++ as indicated
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: One size.
gauge: Gauge is not important in this project.
instructions:
NECKLACE
Ch 70 (62).
Round 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 3, skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch**; repeat from * across, ch 3; turn and work across opposite side of foundation ch; sc in same st; repeat from * to ** across, ch 3; join with slip st to first sc—15 ch-3 spaces each side and 2 ch-3 spaces each end.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, *3 sc in ch-3 space, sc in next sc, repeat from * across, ending 5 sc in last ch-3 space, +[sc in next sc, 3 sc in next ch-3 space] 2 times++, **[sc in next sc, (2 sc, picot, 2 sc) all in ch-3 space] 4 (3) times***, sc in next sc, (sc, CQ 10, sc) all in next ch-3 space, sc in next sc, (sc, CQ 15, sc) all in next ch-3 space, sc in next sc, (sc, CQ 20, sc) all in next ch-3 space, sc in next sc, (sc, CQ 15, sc) all in next ch-3 space, sc in next sc, (sc, CQ 10, sc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from ** to *** once, then repeat from + to ++ once, sc in next sc, 5 sc in last space; join with slip st to first sc. Fasten off.
Tie
Ch 100. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Tie a small knot in each end of tie and weave tie thru end loops.
EARRINGS (Make 2)
Ch 15. CQ 13. Fasten off.
Weave in ends. Attach earring findings.
AUNT LYDIA’S® “Fashion Crochet Metalics” Size 5, Art. 155 available 100 yd (135m) balls.
OR AUNT LYDIA’S® “Fashion Crochet Thread” Size 3, Art.182 available 150 yd (137 m) balls.

Size No. 2 (1.5 mm) Steel crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] long x 3/4" [2 cm] wide, excluding clasp and chain.
gauge: 36 sc and 40 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 116.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 115 sc.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1). Skip next sc. *1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row:  Skip first 2 sc. *5 dc in next sc. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next sc. Sl st in last sc.
Fasten off.
Using a 7mm jump ring, connect one end of Choker to metal chain. Using second 7mm jump ring, connect necklace clasp to other end of Choker.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Metallic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 0001P White/Pearl.
Susan Bates® Steelite® Crochet Hook: 1.60 mm [US 6].
Liquid sealant such as FrayCheck™ optional
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Earring motif measures 1½” diameter.
gauge: 1½” diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
EARRINGS (make 2)
Ch 6; join with slip st to form ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3, work 13 dc in ring; join – 14 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st; (work pc in next st, 2 dc in next st) around; work pc in last st; join – 7 pc.
Round 3: Ch 2, dc in next st,ch 1; shell in pc, ch 1, (dc2tog, ch 1, shell in next pc, ch 1) around; join with slip st in first dc2tog – 7 shells.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends, securing them with liquid sealant, if needed. Sew bead in center of earring. With pliers, open loop on earring wire, put it through any shell’s ch 2 space; pinch loop with pliers to shut firmly.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Sashay Metallic™: 1 ball each 1961 Icy Mint A and 1990 Icy Peri B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
measurements: Necklace measures 27” (68.5 cm) long. Center woven square measures 4” x 4” (10 x 10 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Cords (make 6 – 3 with A and 3 with B)
Leaving a 5” (12.5 cm) tail, ch 38. Fasten off, leaving a 5” (12.5 cm) tail.
Woven Square
Fold A cords in half and place on work surface to your left as shown in Weaving Diagram, ensuring that ends are even. 
Refer to Weaving Diagram. Beginning with cord near folded edge, weave B cord under and over A cords 3 times. Gently pull B cord through until half the cord is woven. With other end of same B cord, weave over and under A cords 3 times. Optional: Temporarily secure these cord lengths with sewing pins before weaving remaining cords. Weave remaining B cords in the same manner. Adjust cords so all weaving is even and remaining lengths of cords are evenly aligned. Push or pull cords as needed to close any visible spaces between cords.
FINISHING
Tie each pair of cord lengths together in overhand knots at edges of Woven Square, keeping finished lengths even.
Tie all three A tails together in an overhand knot at end of chains; repeat with the three B tails. Trim these tails to 2” (5 cm). Cut a 3” (7.5 cm) length of each yarn and spread open. To encase tail ends, wrap each length of yarn around matching tail and pin in place, turning in cut edge for a smoother finish; sew to secure.
Sew toggle clasp pieces to ends of necklace.

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6. oz;288 m/315 yds)
One size US H-8 (5mm) crochet hook, or size to obtain gauge.
Necklace—Thirty-six 24mm split rings; and ten 32mm split rings.
Bracelet II—Ten 24mm split rings; and two 32mm split rings.
Simply Soft Party (85 g/3. oz;150 m/164 yds)
measurements: Finished measurements: Necklace measures approximately 32"/81.5cm circumference, Bracelet I measures approximately 7 1/2"/19cm inside circumference, Bracelet II measures approximately 7"/18cm inside circumference
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SPECIAL TECHNIQUE
Covering sc (to cover split rings)—Place a slip knot on the hook. *Insert hook, from front to back, into center of ring. Take yarn over top of ring, from front to back. Yarn over and draw loop to front. Bring yarn, from back to front, over top of ring, yarn over and draw through both loops on hook (1 sc worked over ring); repeat from * number of times indicated. Push stitches together and rotate ring as you work; join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off and weave in ends. Note: To reduce the amount of weaving in, work the covering sc over the beginning tail. 

NOTES
1. Necklace and each bracelet is created by joining and covering split rings.
2. When instructed to cover a 32mm split ring, work 32 covering sc (see Special Technique) over the ring. When instructed to cover a 24mm split ring, work 24 covering sc over the ring. And, when instructed to cover a 2"/50mm split ring, work 54 covering sc over the ring.

NECKLACE
Join Rings: Join split rings into a circle in the following order: [One 32mm ring, four 24mm rings] 9 times, one 32mm ring. Join last ring to first ring.
Cover Rings: Cover first 32mm ring with A, cover next ring with B, *cover next ring with A, cover next ring with B; repeat from * around.

BRACELET I
Join Rings: Join ten 32mm split rings into a circle, joining last ring to first ring.
Cover Rings: Beg with A cover each ring.

BRACELET II
Join Rings: Join split rings into a circle in the following order: One 32mm ring, four 24mm rings, one 32mm ring, six 24mm rings. Join last ring to first ring.
Cover Rings: With A, cover first 32mm ring and next 24mm ring; with B cover next three rings; with A, cover next three rings; with B cover next three rings; with A, cover last 24mm ring.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 0324 Bright Yellow A, 254 Pumpkin B, 316 Soft White C; small amount 312 Black D; 1 skein 3620 Glowworm E
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Long Strand measures 35” (89 cm), Short Strand measures 26” (66 cm)
gauge: Pumpkin = 2” (5 cm) wide and 1” (2.5 cm) high; 16 slip sts worked into 16 chs = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PUMPKIN (Make 5)
Using B, make Adjustable Loop.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 5 sc in ring; pull tail to close; do not join – 5 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc – 10 sc.
Round 3: (4 dc, hdc) in next sc, hdc in next sc, sc in next sc, slip st in next sc, sc in next sc, hdc in next sc, (hdc, 4 dc) in next sc, skip next sc, slip st in next sc, skip last sc – 17 sts. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Referring to photo, embroider a stem on each Pumpkin using D.
NECKLACE
Short Strand
Place all motifs with right sides facing. With E, ch 35.
Round 1: Referring to photo for placement, sc in edge of a Pumpkin; ch 15, sc in point of a Candy corn, ch 15, sc in edge of a Pumpkin, ch 35; join with slip st in first ch, being careful not to twist – 103 sts.
Round 2: Without turning, slip st in each ch and sc around; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
Long Strand
With E, ch 20.
Round 1: Referring to photo for placement, sc in edge of a Pumpkin; ch 25, sc in point of a Candy corn, ch 25, sc in edge of a Pumpkin, ch 20, sc in point of a Candy corn, ch 25, sc in edge of a Pumpkin, ch 20; join with slip st in first ch, being careful not to twist – 140 sts. Sc in join of Short Strand.
Round 2: Repeat Round 2 of Short Strand. Fasten off.
Special Stitches
Beginning sc2tog = Draw up a loop in first st, draw up a loop in next st, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Beginning dc2tog = Yarn over, insert hook in first stitch, *yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops; yarn over, insert hook in next stitch; repeat from *; yarn over, draw through all loops on hook.
dc2tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all loops on hook.
Special Technique
Adjustable Loop: With long side of yarn in the palm of your hand, wrap yarn around finger. Insert hook under the wrap, grab yarn and pull through; ch 1, release circle around finger gently, work the specified number of stitches; pull tail gently to tighten the ring.
Note
All rows and rounds are worked with right sides facing. 
CANDY CORN (Make 3)
With A, ch 5.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 4 hdc. Fasten off.
Row 2: Join B in first hdc, ch 2; work Beginning dc2tog, work dc2tog – 2 dc. Fasten off.
Row 3: Join C in first dc, ch 1; work Beginning sc2tog – 1 sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Cut a 12-inch strand of E; referring to photo, bind both strands of Necklace together at join; weave in ends. Block if desired.

gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
NECKLACE
Large Flower (Make One)
Chain 25; hdc in 3rd ch from hook, hdc in each ch across. Fasten off leaving 18” end.
Medium Flower (Make 2)
Chain 14; sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across. Fasten off leaving 18” end.
Small Flower (Make 3)
Chain 11; sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across. Fasten off leaving 18” end.
Assembly
Thread long tail into yarn needle. Begin to coil crochet strip, twisting now and then to form flower. Secure shape on wrong side with small stitches. Weave in ends.
Sew 3 beads to the center of each flower. Sew flowers in random order to center of ribbon. Sew 3 beads along ribbon on each side of flowers.

materials: auNT LYDIa’S® “Bamboo Crochet Thread”: 2 balls 0558 Orchid.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated;
[] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Necklace measures 1¼” wide x 32½” long excluding lowers and dangles.
gauge: 20 sts = 4”; 22 rows in sc = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NeCKLaCe
Ch 162.
Row 1 (right side): Working in back ridge of ch sts, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 161 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 12 sc, ch 21, skip next 21 sc, sc in next 12 sc, ch 32, skip next 32 sc, sc in next 23 sc, ch 16, skip next 16 sc, sc in next 12 sc, ch 21, skip next 21 sc, sc in last 12 sc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st and ch across; turn – 161 sc.
Rows 4-7: Repeat Rows 2-3 twice. Fasten off.
Flower (Make 4)
Round 1: Ch 4, dc in 4th ch from hook, ch 1, [2 dc, ch 1] 5 times in same ch, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-4 – 6 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st in next dc, (sc, dc, 2 tr, dc, sc) in each ch-1 space around, join with slip st in first sc in beginning st, drop loop from hook, insert hook, from back to front, through same st as joining, pick up dropped loop, pull dropped loop to back of work – 6 petals.
Round 3: *Ch 4, working behind petals, insert hook through the base of last st on current petal and base of first st on next petal, yo, pull through base of both sts and loop on hook; repeat from * 5 times – ch-4 spaces.
Round 4: *(Sc, [dc, 2 tr, dc, sc] twice) in next ch-4 space; repeat from * 5 times, join with slip st in first sc, drop loop from hook, insert hook, from back to front, through same st as joining, pick up dropped loop, pull dropped loop to back of work – 6 petals.
Round 5: *Ch 6, working behind petals, insert hook through the base of last st on current petal and base of first st on next petal, yo, pull through base of both sts and loop on hook; repeat from * 5 times – 6 ch-6 spaces.
Round 6: *(Sc, [dc, 2 tr, dc, sc] 3 times) in each ch-6 space around, join with slip st in first sc – 6 petals.  
Fasten off.
Dangles
Leaf (Make 4)
Side a
Ch 10. 
Round 1: Working in back ridge of ch sts, sc in 2nd ch from hook, dc in next ch, tr in next 3 ch, dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next ch, slip st in next ch, working across opposite side of foundation ch, work slip st in first ch, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, tr in next 3 ch, dc in next ch, sc in next ch, join with slip st in first sc. Do not fasten off.
Stem
Ch 15. Fasten off.
Side B
Repeat Round 1 of Leaf Side A. 
With wrong sides of Leaf Sides A & B together, working in back ridge of ch sts, slip st in each ch on stem. Fasten off. 
Whip st Leaf Sides A & B together, matching sts.
Butterfly (Make 4)
Side a
Rnd 1: Ch 2, work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join. 
Rnd 2: (Sc, ch 3, tr, picot, dtr, tr, ch 3, sc) in next sc, (slip st, ch 3, tr, picot, tr, ch 2, slip st) in next sc, slip st in next sc, ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each of next 2 ch (body made), (slip st, ch 2, 2 tr, picot, ch 3, slip st) in next sc, (sc, ch 3, tr, dtr, picot, tr, ch 3, sc) in next sc, fold body up so that the end of body covers next st on round 1, insert hook through end of body into next sc in round 1, yo, draw yarn through all loops on hook for slip st. Do not join.
Stem
Ch 20. Fasten off.
Side B
Repeat Rounds 1-2 of Butterfly side A. 
With wrong sides of Butterflies Sides A & B together, working in back ridge of ch sts, slip st in each ch across stem. Fasten off. Whip st Butterflies Sides A & B together, matching sts.
Heart (Make 4)
Round 1: Ch 2, work 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 3, 2 dtr) in next sc, 2 tr in next sc, (dc, hdc) in next sc, (dc, tr, dc) in next sc, (hdc, dc) in next sc, 2 tr in next sc, (2 dtr, ch 3, slip st) in next sc, join with slip st in first slip st. Do not fasten off.
Stem
Ch 15. Fasten off.
Side B
Repeat Rounds 1-2 of Heart Side A. 
With wrong sides of Hearts Sides A & B together, working in back ridge of ch sts, slip st in each ch across stem. Fasten off. Whip st Hearts Sides A & B together, matching sts.
FINISHING
Attach one of each Dangle to center back of every Flower. 
Attach flowers to scarf on 12-sc sections. Using beading needles, sew 5 glass beads to the center of each flower.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 672 Spring Green A, 368 Paddy Green B, and 316 Soft White C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.

instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Page 1 of 2
Get ready to enjoy having the “luck of the Irish” with this easy-to-crochet necklace. Shamrock and leprechaun hat charms are joined to crocheted chain for this fun Saint Patrick’s Day accessory!
Row 6: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), 4 dc in first st, hdc in next 3 st, 5 dc in last st—13 sts. Fasten off. 
Buckle
With right side facing and C, backstitch a centered square on Row 5. 
LONG NECKLACE 
With B, ch 48.
Row 1: With right sides facing and working in top of beginning ch of CL in center leaf of each shamrock, slip st in first shamrock, ch 13, slip st in next shamrock, ch 15, slip st in center st of top of hat, ch 15, slip st in next shamrock, ch 13, slip st in last shamrock, ch 48. Fasten off.
SHORT NECKLACE 
With B, ch 43. 
Row 1: With right sides facing and working in top of beginning ch of CL in center leaf of each shamrock, slip st in first shamrock, [ch 13, slip st in next shamrock] twice, ch 43. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Ensure that necklace chains are not twisted. With right sides of motifs facing and short necklace positioned above long necklace, join all 4 ends of necklaces together. Weave in ends.
Special Stitch
CL (cluster) = Ch 3, yo, insert hook in indicated stitch, yo and pull up loop, yo, draw in 2 loops on hook (2 loops remain on hook); [yo, insert hook in same stitch, yo and pull up loop, yo, draw in 2 loops] 2 times, yo, draw in all 4 loops on hook.
Notes
1. Necklace is made from 2 sections joined together.
2. Four shamrock and hat motifs are joined to long necklace; 3 shamrocks are joined to short necklace.
3. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw in all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Cut old color.
SHAMROCK (make 7)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: CL in same st as join (leaf made), [slip st in next 2 st, CL in same st as last slip st made (leaf made)] twice, slip st in next st, ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 3 ch; join with slip st in first sc—3 leaves and 1 stem made. Fasten off.
HAT
Working from top down, with A, ch 6.
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, sc in each ch, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. 
Rows 3 and 4: Repeat Row 2 twice; change to B at end of Row 4.
Row 5: Repeat Row 2 once; change to A.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each in 458 Purple A and 12 Black B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Gauge is not critical for this project.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
EARRINGS & NECKLACE
WEB (Make 3; 1 for each Earring and 1 for Necklace)
With A, make an adjustable loop ring.
Round 1: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3), [dc in ring, ch 3] 5 times, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch – 6 dc and ch-3 spaces. Tighten beginning loop.
Round 2: Ch 8 (counts as dc and ch 5), [dc in next dc, ch 5] 5 times, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch.
Round 3: Ch 12 (counts as dc and ch 9), [dc in next dc, ch 9] 5 times, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch.
Round 4: Ch 1, [10 sc in ch-9 space, sc in dc, ch 3, sc in same dc] 6 times, slip st in first ch.
Fasten off.
SPIDERS (Make 3; 1 for each Earring and 1 for Necklace)
With B, make an adjustable loop ring.
Round 1: Ch 2, work 20 hdc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch. Tighten beginning loop.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in next 3 hdc, ch 6, slip st in second ch from hook and in next 4 ch, sc in same hdc (first spider leg), sc in next 2 hdc, ch 5, slip st in second ch from hook and in next 3 ch, sc in same hdc (second spider leg), sc in next 2 hdc, ch 4, slip st in second ch from hook and in next 2 ch, sc in same hdc (third spider leg), sc in next 3 hdc, ch 2, sc in same hdc, sc in next 2 hdc, ch 2, sc in next 3 hdc (spider mouth), ch 4, slip st in second ch from hook and in next 2 ch, sc in same hdc (fourth spider leg), sc in next 2 hdc, ch 5, slip st in second ch from hook and in next 3 ch, sc in same hdc (fifth spider leg), sc in next 2 hdc, ch 6, slip st in second ch from hook and in next 4 ch, sc in same hdc (sixth spider leg), sc in last hdc, slip st in beginning ch, ch 12 for Earrings or 250 ch for Necklace. Fasten off. Cut thread leaving a long tail for attaching.
Using photo as a guide and with A, embroider eyes on each Spider.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Mix equal amounts of white glue and water. Saturate Webs and Spiders with glue mixture, leaving last 12 (250) ch of Spider without glue. Shape and pin out Web and Spider on blocking board and allow to dry. Sew long tail from Spider ch to one point of Web, allowing to hang freely.
Earrings
Attach ear wire hooks to top edge.
Necklace
Thread long ch of Spider through one spoke of Web to secure Spider to Web and make neck piece. Secure opposite end to beginning of long ch.
SPECIAL TECHNIQUE
Adjustable loop ring: Holding the thread a few inches [cms] from the end, wrap around your finger. Do not remove wrap from finger, insert hook into the wrap and draw up a loop of working thread. Chain one to secure the loop and remove ring from finger. Work stitches of first round in the ring. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Bamboo Ice™, Size 3: 1 ball 3631 Green Tea Ice
One 7⁄8” (2.2 cm) or 1” (2.5 cm) decorative button
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Bracelet measures 7” x 11⁄8” (17.8 x 2.9 cm)
gauge: 8 repeats of Rows 5 and 6 = 4” (10cm), 8 sts = 11⁄8” (3cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook needed to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
FINISHING
Using photo as a guide, sew button to center of Button Circle with Right Side facing. Weave in ends.
Special Abbreviations
dc2tog [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
dc3tog [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
Bracelet is made by first working button circle in continuous rounds. Band is then worked in turned rows from one side of the circle, alternating rows of crossed dc and sc.
BRACELET
Button Circle
Round 1: Leaving long tail for sewing, ch 2, 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in next st—18 sc.
Band
Note: Work now progresses in turned rows.
Row 4: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in same st, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st, 2 hdc in next st, leaving remaining sts unworked—4 hdc and 4 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across—8 sts.
Row 6 (Right Side): Ch 3 (counts as dc), skip first st, [skip next st, dc in next st, dc in skipped st] 3 times, dc in last st.
Row 7: Repeat Row 5.
Rows 8-27: Repeat Rows 6-7, 10 times.
Row 28: Ch 2, turn, skip first st, dc2tog, ch 3, skip 2 sts (button hole made), dc3tog—2 sts and 1 ch-3 space.
Row 29: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, 5 sc in ch-3 space, sc in next st, slip st in top of beginning ch-2—8 sts.

materials: Size 3.25 mm (U.S. D or 3) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Small: approx 3½ ins [9 cm] diameter; Medium: approx 4½ ins [11.5 cm] diameter.
gauge: 18 sc and 18 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
SMALL BOX
Lid
**With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: (RS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around.
Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.**
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only: 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join A with sl st to first sc.
12th rnd: With A, ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in first sc. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Miss last 2 sc. Sl st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
BOTTOM
Work from ** to ** as given for Lid. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only: 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
9th to 14th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
15th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
MEDIUM BOX
Lid
***Work from ** to ** as given for Lid of Small Box. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.***
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loop only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
12th and 13th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join A with sl st to first sc.
15th rnd: With A, ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in first sc. *Miss next 2 sc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Miss last 2 sc. Sl st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
BOTTOM
Work from *** to *** as given for Lid. 54 sc. 
10th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
11th to 18th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
19th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
FLOWER (make 1 for either Box).
With A, ch 4. 
1st rnd: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 
Ch 3. (Sl st. Ch 3. 1 dc. Ch 3) 4 times in same sp. Sl st in same sp. Fasten off. 
Sew to top of Lid as shown in picture.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 486 Navy
abbreviations: dc3tog= work 3 double crochet stitches together
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Necklace measures 22” (56 cm) long
gauge: Gauge is not essential for this project.
instructions:
Motif 2 (make 2)
Ch 5, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Rnd 1 (RS): Ch 1, 10 sc in ring, join with slip st in first sc—10 sc.
Rnd 2: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, ch 6, skip sc; repeat from * 3 times more, sc in next sc, slip st in next st, join with slip st in beginning ch-1.
Rnd 3: Work (slip st, ch 3, 3 dc, ch 2, slip st, ch 2, 3 dc, ch 3, slip st) in each ch-6 space around. Fasten off.
Motif 3 (make 2)
Ch 21.
Rnd 1: Tr in 6th ch from hook, ch 2, skip 2, tr in next ch, [ch 2, skip 2, dc in next ch] 3 times, ch 2, sc in last ch.
Rnd 2: Ch 1, 3 sc in each of next 5 ch-2 spaces, 8 sc in beginning ch-5 space (where ch were skipped); working in opposite side of ch, work 2 sc in each of next 5 ch-2 spaces, sc in sc, join with slip st in beginning ch-1. Fasten off.
Motif 4 (make 2)
Ch 5, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Rnd 1 (RS): Ch 1, 10 sc in ring, join with slip st in first sc—10 sc.
Rnd 2: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, ch 6, skip sc; repeat from * 2 times more, sc in next sc, slip st in next 3 sts, join with slip st in beginning ch-1.
Rnd 3: Work (slip st, ch 3, 3 dc, ch 2, slip st, ch 2, 3 dc, ch 3, slip st) in each ch-6 space around. Fasten off.
Motif 5 with Stem (make 2)
Ch 16.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, ch 2, slip st in same st as last sc, turn.
Row 2: Ch 3, work 9 dc in ch-2 space, turn.
Row 3: [Ch 3, dc3tog over next 3 dc, ch 3, work slip st in same dc] 3 times. Fasten off.
Motif 1 (make 2)
Ch 5, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Rnd 1 (RS): Ch 1, 10 sc in ring, join with slip st in first sc—10 sc.
Rnd 2: (Ch 3, dc) in first sc, (ch 2, sc, ch 2) in next sc,*3 dc in next sc, (ch 2, sc, ch 2) in next sc; repeat from * 3 times more, dc in same st as beginning ch-3, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Rnd 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, ch 7, (dc, ch 2, sc, ch 2, dc) in sc, skip next dc,*sc in next dc, ch 7, (dc, ch 2, sc, ch 2, dc) in sc, skip next dc; repeat from * 3 times more, join with slip st in beginning sc.
Rnd 4: Ch 1, work (sc, ch 2, dc, [ch 1, dc] 6 times, ch 2, sc) in each ch-7 space around, join with slip st in beginning sc.
Rnd 5: Ch 1, *sc in ch-2 space, sc in ch-1 space, 2 sc in each of next 4 ch-1 spaces, sc in ch-1 space, sc in ch-2 space; repeat from * 4 times more, join with slip st in beginning sc. Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Sew pieces together according to photo. Sew finished motives to prepared jewelry as directed. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Sizzle™, 1 spool each of 8251 Citron A, 8621 Lime B, 8529 Parakeet C, 8540 Purple D, 8930 Fiesta Mix E, 8700 Bright Pink F and 8110 Ivory G
Susan Bates® Steel Crochet Hook: 2.55 mm [US 0]
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc = Colors A, B, C, etc
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
( ) = work directions in parentheses as indicated
measurements: Finished Size: 5 (6)" (12.5 (15) cm) excluding ties
gauge: 6 sts = 1" (2.5 cm); 7 rows = 1" (2.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Row 2: Ch 1, turn; skip first sc, sc in next 2 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc, skip last sc: 7 sc.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures approximately 5(6)” (12.5 (15) cm).
Ch 15; fasten off.
Trim ends to desired length.
GRID BRACELET
With A, ch 36 (40).
Row 1 (RS): Dc in fifth ch from hook, *ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * across; fasten off.
Border
Join F with slip st in any ch-1 space on foundation ch.
Round 1 (RS): Ch 1, (sc in base of next dc, sc in ch-1 space) around to end of row, work 5 sc in end of row, (sc in next dc, sc in next ch-1 space) around to end of row, work 5 sc in end of row, (sc in base of next dc, sc in ch-1 space) around to first sc; join with slip st to first sc; fasten off.
Tie

Using photo as a guide, weave Tie through Bracelet.

OMBRE BRACELET

Fasten off.
With B, ch 15, join with sc in sixteenth ch on A ch.
Row 1 (RS): Sc in each ch across, ch 15; fasten off.
With C, ch 15, join with sc to sixteenth ch on previous ch.
Row 2: Sc in each ch across, ch 15; fasten off.
With D, ch 15, join with sc to sixteenth ch on previous ch.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 4 yds 495 Wood Violet
sewing or beading needle and matching thread
two silver seed beads (one for each earring)
four 6mm gray glass pearl beads (two for each earring)
two silver fishhook earring wires (one for each earring)
abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: One earring measures ½” (12.7 mm) wide and 1½” (3 cm) long, not including earring wire.
gauge: One crocheted bead measures about 1/2” (12.7 mm) x 5/8” (15.9 mm). Use hook size needed to obtain finished size of bead. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FINISHING
For each earring: With sewing or beading needle and matching thread, string beads in the following order: seed bead (for anchor), pearl bead, crocheted bead, pearl bead, crocheted bead. Take care to thread crochet beads straight through center, to ensure that they do not hang crookedly. Sew earring wire to top of earring. Weave in any remaining ends.

SPECIAL STITCH
sc2tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

NOTES
1.Each earring is made from two crocheted beads that are separated by pearl beads.
2. Crocheted beads are worked in continuous rounds. Do not join and do not turn at the ends of rounds. A stitch marker can be used to indicate the end of rounds.
3. One end of each crocheted bead looks tidier than the other. Arrange beads accordingly.

CROCHETED BEADS  
(make 4 – 2 per earring)
Ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 2 sc in each ch around—6 sc. Place a marker (optional) in last stitch to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Rounds 3–5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sts.
Stuff bead with a pinch of fiberfill. Use blunt end of crochet hook, or something similar, to tamp stuffing in place.
Round 7: Sc2tog, [skip next st, slip st in next st] twice.
Fasten off. Weave in ends. Trim stray ends of fiberfill, if needed.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet, Size 10: 1 ball 495 Wood Violet
measurements: Earrings measures 1½” x 1¼” (4 x 3.2 cm)
gauge: 3 rows = 1” (2.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
EARRING (Make 2)
Row 1: Ch 5, work 6 tr in 5th ch from hook; turn – 7 tr.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 3, dc in same tr, [dc in next 2 tr, 2 dc in next tr] twice; turn – 10 dc.
Row 3: Ch 5 (counts as first tr and ch 1), [tr in next dc, ch 1] 8 times; tr in last dc; turn – 10 tr and 9 ch-1 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each tr and ch-1 space across – 19 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Starch if desired. With sewing thread on beading needle, space 6mm jasper beads evenly across Row 4 using seed beads as anchors. With needle nosed pliers, open loop on earring wires and close over starting ch at tip of triangle.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Crochet Thread Classic™ 10 (Colors: 300 yds/274.32 m)
Size U.S. 9 [1.25 mm] Susan Bates® steel crochet hook
measurements: Approx 1½" [4 cm] diameter, excluding earring wire.
instructions:
Rose (Make 2 – one in each color)
See diagram on page 2.
Ch 4, leaving a long end to use for gathering center closed when Rose is complete. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc. 2 hdc. 2 dc. 3 tr) all in ring. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Working behind 1st rnd, ch 1. Sl st between first 2 sc. Ch 3. Sl st between next 2 hdc. Ch 3. Sl st between next 2 dc. Ch 3. Sl st between next 2 tr. Ch 3. Sl st after last tr. Ch 3. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 ch-3 loops.
3rd rnd: *Ch 1. (5 dc. Sl st) in next ch-3 loop. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first ch 1. 5 petals.
4th rnd: Working behind last rnd, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 5. Sl st in sp between next 2 petals. Rep from * 3 times more. Ch 5. Join with sl st in first sc. 5 ch-5 loops.
5th rnd: *Ch 1. (2 dc. 4 tr. 2 dc. Sl st) in next ch-5 loop. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first ch 1. 5 petals.
6th rnd: Working behind last rnd, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 7. Sl st in sp between next 2 petals. Rep from * 3 times more. Ch 7. Join with sl st in first sc. 5 ch-7 loops.
7th rnd: *Ch 1. (3 dc. 5 tr. 3 dc. Sl st) in next ch-7 loop. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first ch 1. 5 petals. Fasten off.
Thread end at starting ring onto a big-eye needle and gather center tog tightly to close flower.
FINISHING
Attach jump ring around a middle tr for last row of petals.
Attach to earring wire.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: One size fits most.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
MOTIFS
Small Flower
Ch 6, slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3), [dc in ring, ch 3] 5 times, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch to join – 6 ch-3 spaces. 
Round 2: [Sc, hdc, 3 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-3 space around – 6 petals.
Round 3: Working in back of work, slip st around post of first dc on Round 1, *ch 5, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 5, slip st in first st – 6 ch-5 spaces.
Round 4: [Sc, hdc, 5 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-5 space around – 6 petals.
Round 5: Working in back of work, slip st around post of first dc on Round 1, *ch 7, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 7, slip st in first st – 6 ch-7 spaces.
Round 6: [Sc, hdc, 7 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-7 space around – 6 petals.
Fasten off.
Large Flower
Thread 30 red glass beads onto working thread. Ch 6, slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3), [dc in ring, ch 3] 5 times, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch to join – 6 ch-3 spaces. 
Round 2: [Sc, hdc, 2 dc, slip 1 bead close to hook, dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-3 space around – 6 petals.
Round 3: Working in back of work, slip st around post of first dc on Round 1, *ch 5, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 5, slip st in first st – 6 ch-5 spaces.
Round 4: [Sc, hdc, 3 dc, slip 1 bead close to hook, 2 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-5 space around – 6 petals.
Round 5: Working in back of work, slip st around post of first dc on Round 1, *ch 7, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 7, slip st in first st – 6 ch-7 spaces.
Round 6: [Sc, hdc, 4 dc, slip 1 bead close to hook, 3 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-7 space around – 6 petals.
Round 7: Working in back of work, slip st around post of first dc on Round 1, *ch 9, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 9, slip st in first st – 6 ch-9 spaces.
Round 8: [Sc, hdc, 5 dc, slip 1 bead close to hook, 4 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-9 space around – 6 petals.
Round 9: Working in back of work, slip st around post of first dc on Round 1, *ch 11, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 11, slip st in first st – 6 ch-11 spaces.
Round 10: [Sc, hdc, 6 dc, slip 1 bead close to hook, 5 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-11 space around – 6 petals.
Fasten off. 
EARRINGS
(Make 2)
Make Small Flower but do not fasten off, slip st around post of dc on Round 1, ch 5, slip st in earring ring, ch 5, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1. 
Fasten off. 
Sew 1 small pearl bead in center of each Small Flower. 
NECKLACE
(Make 2 Small Flowers and one Large Flower)
Slip st into spring ring, ch 132, slip st into jump ring. 
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, turn, skip 1 ch, sc in each ch across – 131 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, sc in each sc across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in 4 sc, [sc in 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 24 times, sc in last 7 sts – 155 sts.
Row 4: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 3), turn, skip next st, dc in next st, [ch 3, skip next st, dc in next st] across. Mark center dc. 
Row 5: Ch 2, turn, [2 sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2] across to last ch-3 space, 3 sc in last ch-3 space. Mark 5th ch-2 space on either side of center dc for Flower placement. 
Row 6: Ch 3, turn, [3 dc, picot in next ch-2 space] across to first marked ch-2 space, 2 dc in ch-2 space, slip st in center st of one petal of first Small Flower, dc in same ch-2 space, (picot, 3 dc, picot) in next ch-2 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 5, slip st in center st of next petal to left of same Small Flower, slip st in center st of one petal of next Large Flower, dc in same ch-2 space, (picot, 3 dc, picot) in next ch-2 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, slip st in center st of next petal to left of same Large Flower, slip st in marked center dc, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, (picot, 3 dc, picot) in next ch-2 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 5, slip st in center st of next petal to left of same Large Flower, slip st in center st of one petal of next Small Flower, dc in same ch-2 space, (picot, 3 dc, picot) in next ch-2 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 5, slip st in center st of next petal to left of same Small Flower, [3 dc, picot in next ch-2 space] across to last ch-2 space, 4 dc in last ch-2 space. 
Fasten off.  
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Sew small pearl beads in center of each Small Flower and large pearl bead in center of Large Flower of Necklace.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Classic Crochet Thread”, Size 10: 1 ball 419 Ecru.
Crochet Hook: 1.75mm [US 3] for earrings; 2.15mm [US 4] for necklace; 1.25mm [US 9] for attaching beads.
about 176 black opal seed beads (size E)
one spring ring and one jump ring (for necklace)
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st.
measurements: Necklace measures 15” around inner edge. One earring measures 1½” long (not including earring loop).
gauge: 9 sts = 1”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
EARRINGS (make 2)
Note: Use 1.75mm [US 3] hook to make earring and 1.25mm [US 9] for attaching beads.
Round 1 (Right Side): Join thread with slip st in bone ring, ch 1, work 11 sc in bone ring, ch 3, slip st in silver earring loop, ch 3, work 25 sc in bone ring; join with slip st in first sc, turn—36 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [attach bead, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 7 times, turn; leave remaining sts unworked—7 sc and 7 beads.
Round 3: Ch 5 (counts as sc, ch 4), [sc in next sc, ch 4] 6 times, sc in beginning ch-1—8 sc and 7 ch-4 spaces. 
Fasten off.
NECKLACE
Note: Use 2.15mm [US 4] hook to make necklace and 1.25mm [US 9] for attaching beads.
Foundation: Join thread with slip st in spring ring, ch 130, slip st in jump ring, turn.
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch across, turn—130 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, slip st in first 10 sc, ch 1, sc in next sc, [attach bead, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 54 times, sc in next sc, turn; leave remaining 10 sc unworked—56 sc and 54 beads.
Row 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, ch 4] 54 times, sc in next sc, turn; leave remaining sts unworked—55 sc and 54 ch-4 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, (sc, attach bead, sc) in each of next 3 ch-4 spaces, (dc, attach bead, dc) in each of next 5 ch-4 spaces, (tr, attach bead, tr) in each of next 5 ch-4 spaces, (dtr, attach bead, dtr) in each of next 5 ch-4 spaces, (ttr, attach bead, ttr) in each of next 3 ch-4 spaces, (quad-tr, attach bead, quad-tr) in each of next 3 ch-4 spaces, (quin-tr, attach bead, quin-tr) in each of next 6 ch-4 spaces, (quad-tr, attach bead, quad-tr) in each of next 3 ch-4 spaces, (ttr, attach bead, ttr) in each of next 3 ch-4 spaces, (dtr, attach bead, dtr) in each of next 5 ch-4 spaces, (tr, attach bead, tr) in each of next 5 ch-4 spaces, (dc, attach bead, dc) in each of next 5 ch-4 spaces, (sc, attach bead, sc) in each of next 3 ch-4 spaces, sc in last sc, turn—110 sts and 54 beads.
Row 5: Ch 1, *skip next st, sc in next st, ch 2, attach bead, ch 2; repeat from * to last 2 sts, skip next st, sc in last st—54 beads. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Love® or 1803 of your RED HEART® With 1 skein 1971 Tigerlily Blue Hawaii or color choice
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook – 4 mm [US G-6]
Pony beads or wood beads with hole large enough to thread yarn through
Needle small enough to fit through hole of bead (threading needle)
2½" [6.5 cm] piece of heavy cardboard (for making tassel)
measurements: Pocket measures about 1¾" [4.5 cm] wide (at widest) x 1¾" [4.5 cm] long, not including tassel and hanging chains.
gauge: 26 sts = 7" [18 cm] 24 rows = 4" [10 cm] in scarf pattern.
instructions:
PENNY POCKET
Pocket Piece (make 2)
Make a slip knot and place it on the hook.
Chain 5.
Row 1: Single crochet (sc) in second chain (ch) from hook and in each of next 3 chains – you will have a total of 4 single crochet stitches in this row.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in last sc – 6 sc.
Rows 3–6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off.
Repeat all of the previous steps to make the second pocket piece.
First Hanging Chain
Leaving a 6" [15 cm] beginning tail, make a slip knot and place it on the hook.
Chain 80.
Join Pieces
Hold the two pocket pieces together with edges and stitches matching.
With chain-80 still on hook, insert hook into end of Row 6 of both pocket pieces at the same time, so that you are ready to work along a side edge. Yarn over and pull a loop through, yarn over and draw through both loops on hook to complete a single crochet stitch that has been worked through both thicknesses. Make single crochet stitches in the same way along the side edge, lower edge, and second side edge. Take care to always insert the hook through both pieces to begin each single crochet stitch and leave the top edge open. Do not fasten off.
Second Hanging Chain
Chain 80.
Fasten off, leaving a 6" [15 cm] ending tail.
Thread yarn tail onto the threading needle. Thread a pony bead onto the 6" [15 cm] ending tail and guide the bead over the hanging chain for about 7 chains. Tie the end of the chain in an overhand knot just below the bead to hold the bead in place. Trim the yarn tail. Repeat to attach a bead to end of first hanging chain.
FINISHING
Tassel
Wrap yarn about 10 times around 5" [12.5 cm] piece of heavy cardboard. Thread an 8" [20.5 cm] length of yarn onto needle and take it under the top of the wraps. Tie into a tight knot for top of tassel. Do not trim the ends; they will be used later.
Slip wraps off of cardboard. Tie a 6" [15 cm] length of yarn around wraps about ½” [1.5 cm] from top for tassel neck. Tie a tight knot and then draw ends to inside of tassel. Cut the lower ends of the wraps and trim to even.
Hold the yarn ends of the top tie together and thread them onto needle. Thread 3 pony beads onto the top tie ends. Take the needle through the center of the bottom of the penny pocket. Secure and trim the ends inside the pocket. Using yarn needle, weave in yarn tails.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each of 451 Parakeet A, 431 Pumpkin B, 332 Hot Pink C, and 421 Goldenrod D
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Bracelet measures about 7” (18 cm) wide x 5” (12.5 cm) long.
gauge: 34 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:

Ruffled Crochet 
Bracelet
For lively warm weather accessories choose cotton 
crochet thread! This bright color combination and 
pretty ruffling add light-hearted style to your look.
See LC4493 for Colorful Ripple Cowl Pattern 
Rows 2-15: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in 
each st across, turn. Change to A in last st of 
Row 15.
FIRST RUFFLE
Row 1 (wrong side): With A, ch 5 (counts 
as dc, ch 2 here and throughout), sc in 
next dc, *ch 4, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc; 
repeat from * to turning ch, ch 2, dc in top 
of turning ch, turn—18 ch-4 spaces (not 
counting the beginning ch-5 space).
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first dc, skip first ch-2 
space, *ch 4, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-4 space; 
repeat from * to turning ch-space, ch 4, sc in 3rd ch of turning ch, turn—37 ch-4 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 5, sc in first ch-4 space, *ch 4, sc 
next ch-4 space; repeat from * to last sc, ch 2, 
dc in last sc, turn—36 ch-4 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 5, sc in first ch-2 space, *ch 4, sc 
in next ch-4 space, ch 4, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next 
ch-4 space; repeat from * to, ch 4, sc in 3rd 
ch of turning ch, turn—55 ch-4 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 5, working behind the ch-4 spaces 
of Row 4, dc in first ch-space of Row 3, *ch 
4, dc in next ch-space of Row 3, ch 4, (dc, ch 
4, dc) in next ch-space of Row 3; repeat from 
* to last ch-space of Row 3 (do not work a
dc in this last ch-space), ch 4, sc in 3rd ch of
turning ch of Row 4. Fasten off.
Notes: Remaining ruffles are worked around
post of stitches in a row of the Base. Always
hold the Base with the right side facing. To
begin each ruffle, you will need to rotate
the Base to be able to join the yarn around
the beginning chain and work across the
indicated row. Sometimes the first ruffle
will be at the top of the piece as you work
a ruffle. Sometimes the first ruffle will be at
the bottom of the piece as you work a ruffle.
Bracelet measures about 7” (18 cm) 
wide x 5” (12.5 cm) long.
Notes
1. To make Bracelet, a base of 15 rows of
double crochet is worked first. Then eight
ruffles are worked across rows of the
base. Finally a buttonhole band is worked
across one long edge and a button band is
worked across the other long edge.
2. Beads and bells are threaded onto the
working thread before some ruffles are
started and are placed as the last row of
the ruffle is worked. If you do not wish
to use beads or small bells, work a ch-1
whenever instructed to “place bead” or
“place bell”.
3. The Bracelet can be worked by reading the
written instructions or the stitch diagrams.
4. To change color, work last stitch of old
color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new
color and draw through all loops on hook
to complete stitch. Proceed with new
color. Fasten off old color.
Special Stitches
Bobble = Yarn over, insert hook in indicated 
stitch, yarn over and pull up loop (3 loops 
on hook), [yarn over, insert hook in same 
stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over] 
2 times, yarn over, draw through all 7 loops 
on hook.
beaded-picot = Ch 2, place bead, ch 1, sc in 
3rd ch from hook (first ch of the ch-2).
place bead (or bell) = Slide bead (or bell) 
up close to hook and work next stitch as 
instructed to capture bead.
BASE
With B, ch 60.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 5th ch from hook 
(3 skipped ch count as first dc), dc in each 
remaining ch across, turn—57 dc.

Five ½” (13 mm) buttons, 257

and thread.

16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in double 
crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.  
Use any size hook to obtain the 
gauge given.
