AUNT  LYDIA’S RUFFLED CROCHET BRACELET | CROCHET    1 of 3
Page 2 of 3
SECOND RUFFLE
Thread 57 seed beads onto B.
Row 1: With right side of Base facing, join B 
with slip st around beginning ch of Row 14, ch 
3 (counts as dc), working around posts of sts 
in Row 14, dc in each st across, turn—57 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, (sc, ch 3, place bead, 2 dc) 
in each dc to beginning ch, sc in top of 
beginning ch. Fasten off.
THIRD RUFFLE
Thread 21 seed beads on D.
Row 1: With right side of Base facing, join D 
with slip st around beginning ch of Row 10, ch 
3 (counts as dc), working around posts of sts 
in Row 10, dc in each st across, turn—57 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first dc, ch 3, skip next 2 
dc, dc in next 3 dc, *ch 3, skip next 2 dc, sc 
in next dc, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 3 
dc; repeat from * to last 3 dc, ch 3, skip next 
2 dc, sc in top of beginning ch, turn—Seven 
3-dc groups.
Row 3: Ch 6 (counts as tr, ch 2), skip first 
ch-3 space, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc, 
dc in next dc, *ch 2, skip next ch-3 space, tr 
in next sc, ch 2, skip next ch-3 space, dc in 
next dc, ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc; 
repeat from * to last ch-3 space, ch 2, skip 
last ch-3 space, tr in last sc, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first tr, *sc in next ch-2 
space, dc in next dc, beaded-picot, (dc, 
beaded-picot, dc) in next ch-1 space, 
beaded-picot, dc in next dc, sc in next ch-2 
space, sc in next tr; repeat from * across 
working the last sc in the 4th ch of turning 
ch. Fasten off.
FOURTH RUFFLE
Thread 57 seed beads onto B.
Row 1: With right side of Base facing, join B 
with slip st around beginning ch of Row 9, ch 
3 (counts as dc), working around posts of sts 
in Row 14, dc in each st across, turn—57 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, (sc, ch 3, place bead, 2 dc) 
in each dc to beginning ch, sc in top of 
beginning ch. Fasten off.
FIFTH RUFFLE
Thread 44 seed beads and 11 small bells onto 
C, threading in the following order: 2 beads, 
1 bell, [4 beads, 1 bell] 10 times, 2 beads.
Row 1: With right side of Base facing, join C 
with slip st around beginning ch of Row 6, ch 
3, working around posts of sts in Row 6, dc 
in each st across, turn—57 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first dc, skip next 2 dc, 6 
dc in next dc, *skip next 4 dc, 6 dc in next dc; 
repeat from * to last 3 dc, skip next 2 dc, sc in 
top of beginning ch, turn—Eleven 6 dc groups.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *[Bobble in next 
dc, place bead] twice, Bobble in next dc, 
place bell, [Bobble in next dc, place bead] 
twice, Bobble in next dc; repeat from * 
across, sc in last sc. Fasten off.
SIXTH RUFFLE
Thread 57 seed beads onto A.
Row 1: With right side of Base facing, join A 
with slip st around beginning ch of Row 5, ch 
3 (counts as dc), working around posts of sts 
in Row 14, dc in each st across, turn—57 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, (sc, ch 3, place bead, 2 dc) 
in each dc to beginning ch, sc in top of 
beginning ch. Fasten off.
SEVENTH RUFFLE
Thread 21 seed beads onto D.
Row 1: With right side of Base facing, join D 
with slip st around beginning ch of Row 1, ch 
3 (counts as dc), working around posts of sts 
in Row 1, dc in each st across, turn—57 dc.
Row 2: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), skip first 3 
dc, dc in next dc, *ch 1, skip next dc, dc in 
next dc; repeat from * to last 3 dc, ch 2, skip 
next 2 dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first dc, sc in next ch-2 
space, dc in next dc, beaded-picot, (dc, 
beaded-picot, dc) in next ch-1 space, 
beaded-picot, dc in next dc, *skip next ch-1 
space, sc in next dc, sc in next ch-1 space, sc 
in next dc, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next 
dc, beaded-picot, (dc, beaded-picot, dc) in 
next ch-1 space, beaded-picot, dc in next 
dc; repeat from * to turning ch-space, sc in 
turning ch-space, sc in 3rd ch of turning ch.
Fasten off.
LAST RUFFLE
Row 1 (wrong side): With wrong side of 
Base facing and working across opposite side 
of foundation ch, join C with slip st in ch at 
base of beginning ch of Row 1, ch 5 (counts 
as dc, ch 2), sc in next ch, *ch 4, sc in next ch; 
repeat from * across, turn—56 ch-4 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 5, working behind ch-4 spaces of 
Row 1 and into spaces between sts of Row 1 
of Base, *ch 4, dc in next space between sts 
of Row 1 of Base; repeat from * to turning ch 
of Row 1 of this ruffle, ch 4, sc in 3rd ch of 
turning ch of Row 1 of this ruffle. Fasten off.
BUTTONHOLE BAND
Row 1: With right side of Base facing, and 
working in ends of rows across left-hand 
long edge, join B with slip st in top left-hand 
corner of Base, ch 1, work 3 sc in end of each 
row of Base (do not work in row ends of 
ruffles), turn—45 sc.
Row 2 (buttonhole row): Ch 1, sc in first sc, 
[ch 4, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 8 sc, ch 4, skip 
next 2 sc, sc in next 9 sc] twice, ch 4, skip last 
2 sc, sc in beginning ch. Fasten off.
BUTTON BAND
Row 1: With right side of Base facing, and 
working in ends of rows across right-hand 
long edge, join B with slip st in lower right-
hand corner of Base, ch 1, work 3 sc in end of 
each row of Base (do not work in row ends 
of ruffles)—45 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With sewing thread, sew buttons across 
button band in line with buttonholes on 
buttonhole band. Weave in ends.
ABBREVIATIONS
A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C, 
etc.; ch = chain; dc = double crochet; sc = 
single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); tr = treble 
crochet;  [ ] = work directions in brackets 
the number of times specified; * = repeat 
whatever follows the * as indicated.

materials: Red Heart® Classic Crochet Thread: Size 10: 1 ball 226 Natural
abbreviations: Sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice; yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Sc3tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over, pull loop through stitch] 3 times (4 loops on hook). Yarn over and draw yarn through all 4 loops on hook.
Dc5tog = [Yo and draw up a loop in indicated st, yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] 5 times; yo and draw through all 6 loops on hook.
measurements: Necklace is 70” long.
gauge: 1 Ball = ¾” x 1¼”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Before beginning to crochet, string wooden beads on thread. To position beads, work to indicated place, remove hook, insert hook through bead and back into last st, pull st through bead, push bead into place.
NECKLACE
Ch 6.
Ball-Round 1: 8 Sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st to 1st sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st, * 2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * to last st, 2 sc in last st; join – 12 sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st, * 2 sc in next st, 1 sc in next st; repeat from * to last st, 2 sc in last st; join – 18 sts.
Round 4: Ch 3 (counts as 1st dc), * dc in next st; repeat from * around; join.
Rounds 5-6: Repeat Round 4.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in same st, * sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from * to last 2 sts; sc2tog; join – 12 sts. Stuff with fiberfill.
Round 8: Repeat Round 7 – 8 sts. Add more fiberfill.
Round 9: Ch 1; [draw up a loop in next st] 5 times; yo and draw through all 6 loops on hook – sc5tog made; [draw up a loop in next st] 3 times, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook – sc3tog made; join with a slip st in middle of sc5tog.
Connector-Row 1: Ch 8, dc5 tog in 3rd ch from hook, ch 6, pull up a bead, dc5tog in 3rd ch from hook, ch 6.
Repeat Rounds 1-9 and Row 1 19 more times. Join to first st; fasten off.
FINISHING: Weave in all ends. Roll each Ball between hands to even out the stuffing and give them their final shape.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 1 White.
Round-nose, chain nose, and split ring pliers
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Necklace measures 12” (31cm) long x 10” (25cm) wide, excluding ties.
gauge: Small flower = 1½” (4cm) diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Round 2: *Ch 5, slip st; repeat from * around, ending with slip st in beginning ch-5—12 loops.
Round 3: Slip st in ch-5 loop, ch 3, 2 dc, 12 tr, 3 dc in same space (beginning petal made), slip st in next ch-5 loop, 3 dc, 12 tr, 3 dc in next ch-5 loop, slip st in next ch-5 loop; repeat from * around, ending slip st in beginning ch-3. Fasten off—6 petals.
SMALL FLOWER (make 7)
Ch 4, join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring, join with a slip st in beginning sc—12 sc.
Round 2: *Ch 5, skip next sc, slip st in next sc; repeat around ending slip st in base of beginning ch-5.
Round 3: Slip st in ch-5 loop, ch 3, 12 dc in same space, *slip st in next ch-5 loop, ** 13 dc in next ch-5 loop; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **. Join with a slip st in beginning ch-3. Fasten off.
TOP LEAF (make 2, one on each side)
Row 1: On right side, join thread with a slip st in ch-5 loop of second double loop of third petal from right (left) of center. Ch 3, 4 dc in same space, 5 dc in next ch-5 loop, 2 dc in next ch-3 loop, 5 dc in each of next 2 ch-5 loops, ch 3, turn—22 dc.
Row 2: Dc in next 9 dc, skip 2 dc, dc in next 9 dc, dc in top of ch 3, ch-3, turn—20 dc.
Row 3: Dc in next 8 dc, skip 2 dc, dc in next 9 sts, ch 3, turn—18 dc.
Row 4: Dc in next 7 dc, skip 2 dc, dc in next 8 sts, ch 3, turn—16 dc.
Row 5: Dc in next 6 dc, skip 2 dc, dc in next 7 sts, ch 3, turn—14 dc.
Row 6: Dc in next 5 dc, skip 2 dc, dc in next 6 sts, ch 3, turn—12 dc.
Row 7: Dc in next 4 dc, skip 2 dc, dc in next 5 sts, ch 3, turn—10 dc.
Row 8: Dc in next 3 dc, skip 2 dc, dc in next 4 sts, ch 3, turn—8 dc.
Row 9: Keeping last loop of each st on hook, dc in next 2 dc, skip 2 dc, dc in next 3 sts, yo, pull through all loops on hook. Do not fasten off.
Ch 76 (for tie), sc in second ch from hook and each sc across, join with slip st to tip of leaf. Fasten off. Repeat on opposite end of necklace.
BOTTOM LEAF
Work as for top leaf over 2 bottom petals of center motif; omit ch 76 and fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Glue a large flower to center of each main motif. Glue a small flower to center of each main motif. Glue a small flower on each leaf. Glue a small flower on top between center and side motifs. Glue a large flower directly under small flower in between motifs. Repeat on other side. Glue a small flower on both sides of bottom leaf next to large flower. Let dry.
Glue one 14mm pearl to center of each flower and one 10mm pearl to the center of each small flower.
Tie Dangles (make 2)
Slide a 2mm, 8mm and a 4mm pearl bead on head pin. With round nose pliers form a loop, insert a split ring. Use chain nose pliers to pull tail of wire and wrap around loop at top of bead. Trim the wire close to the bead. Use pliers to press end down. With split ring pliers attach split ring to sc at end of tie.

materials: Yarn needle, ⅝” - ¾” (15.9 – 19.0 mm) button
measurements: Measure your wrist and multiply that number by 4. This will be the length of the chain you will crochet.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this pattern
instructions:
1. Make a slip knot and crochet a chain to measurement equal to 4 times your wrist measurement. [6” (15.2 cm) wrist = 24” chain; 7” (18 cm) wrist = 28” (71 cm) chain; 8” (20 cm) wrist = 32” (32 cm) chain]. Fasten off leaving a 10” (25 cm) tail.
2. Insert tail in yarn needle, make loop to fit around button, take a small stitch to secure. Weave in end and trim excess yarn.
3. Using yarn needle, weave in beginning end. Sew button to this end with sewing needle and thread.

materials: Aunt Lydia's® Crochet Thread Classic™ 10 (White & Natural: 400 yds/365.76 m, Colors: 300 yds/274.32 m)
Size U.S. 9 [1.25 mm] Susan Bates® steel crochet hook
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Small Gnome Earring: Approx 1" [2.5 cm] tall, excluding earring wire. Medium: Approx 1¼" [3 cm] tall, excluding earring wire. Large: Approx 2" [5 cm] tall, excluding earring wire.
gauge: Not specified
instructions:
Notes:
• Body and hat worked in continuous rnds
• Make 2 of desired size.
• Picture shows Medium and Large sizes of Earrings
SMALL GNOME
See diagrams on page 4.
Body: With A, ch 2. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 scbl in each sc around.
4th to 6th rnds: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Beard: With B, ch 2.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 1 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in sc. Turn. 2 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 3 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 5 sc.
Nose: With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 2 sc. Fasten off leaving long tail.
Stitch on top of beard, on row below top row.
Hat: With D, ch 2. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 6 sc. 
3rd and alt rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 9 sc.
6th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 12 sc.
8th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 15 sc.
10th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 18 sc.
Fasten off leaving long tail.
Stuff Body and Hat. Place Hat over top of Body so that 12th row hands over top of Body and sew tog.
MEDIUM GNOME
See diagrams on page 5.
Body: With A, ch 2. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sts.
4th row: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 24 sts.
5th rnd: 1 scbl in each sc around.
6th to 8th rnds: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Beard: With B, ch 2.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 1 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in sc. Turn. 2 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 3 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 5 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off leaving long tail.
Stitch Beard to front of Body. Note: Beard should cover side from top to bottom.
Nose: With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 3 sc. Fasten off leaving long tail.
Stitch on top of beard, on row below top row.
Hat: With D, ch 2. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 6 sc. 
3rd and alt rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 9 sc.
6th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 12 sc.
8th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 15 sc.
10th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 18 sc.
12th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 3 times. 21 sc.
14th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 3 times. 24 sc.
Fasten off leaving long tail.
Stuff Body and Hat. Place Hat over top of Body so that 12th row hands over top of Body and sew tog.
LARGE GNOME
See diagrams on page 6.
Body: With A, ch 2. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sts.
4th row: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 24 sts.
5th rnd: 1 scbl in each sc around.
6th to 12th rnds: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Beard: With B, ch 2.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 1 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in sc. Turn. 2 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 3 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 5 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off leaving long tail.
Stitch Beard to front of Body. Note: Beard should cover side from top to bottom.
Nose: With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc. Fasten off leaving long tail.
Stitch on top of beard, on row below top row.
Hat: With D, ch 2. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 6 sc.
3rd and alt rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 9 sc.
6th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 12 sc.
8th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 15 sc.
10th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 18 sc.
12th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 3 times. 21 sc.
14th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 3 times. 24 sc.
16th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 3 times. 27 sc.
18th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts) 3 times. 30 sc. Fasten off leaving long tail.
Stuff Body and Hat. Place Hat over top of Body so that 12th row is positioned over top of Body and sew tog.
FINISHING
Attach jump ring through top of Gnome’s hat and to earring wire.

materials: RED HEART® Vivid™: 1 ball 6804 Electric Blue
measurements: Necklace measures 24” (61 cm) around neck opening
gauge: 6 ch = 4” (10 cm) with 2 strands of yarn held together. Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
LARGE FLOWER
With 1 strand, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 2, 9 dc in ring; join with slip st in beginning ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Using tails, tie ends of Neck Chain together, wrapping tails around to hide knot. Use tails to sew flowers to necklace at end of ch-18 loop. Weave in any remaining ends.

NOTES
1. Two strands are held together to make the thick central Neck Chain. Then a single strand is used to work chain-loops with ends attached to the Neck Chain.
2. Ends of the Neck Chain are tied together and two flowers sewn to the piece to complete the necklace.

NECKLACE
Neck Chain: With 2 strands of yarn held together, ch 35. Cut 1 strand, leaving a tail to weave in, and continue working with 1 strand only.
Row 1: Slip st in first 5 ch, ch 22, skip next 14 ch of Neck Chain, slip st in next ch, place a marker in the 7th ch just skipped, ch 18, skip next 9 ch of Neck Chain, slip st in next ch; leave last 5 ch unworked—1 ch-22 loop, and 1 ch-18 loop. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Do not turn piece. Hold piece with Neck Chain at lower edge.
Row 2: Draw up a loop of yarn (1 strand only) in marked ch of Neck Chain, remove marker, ch 5, slip st in 18th ch of ch-22 loop, ch 11, slip st in 6th ch of ch-18 loop. Fasten off and weave in ends, but do not weave in ends of Neck Chain. Neck Chain ends are used later to join Neck Chain into a circle.

SMALL FLOWER
With 1 strand, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 9 hdc in ring; join with slip st in beginning ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 5 yds 401 Orchid Pink
Sewing or beading needle and matching thread
Three 3.6mm faceted white glass pearl beads
Five 5.5mm cylindrical white glass pearl beads
abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Pendant measures 1½” (3.8 cm) wide by 1¼” (3.2 cm) tall, not including jump-ring or chain.
gauge: Use finished size of pendant for gauge. Use hook size needed to obtain finished size. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FINISHING
Referring to photograph and assembly diagram, arrange crocheted beads into a cluster, with less tidy ends of beads in the center. With a length of crochet thread, sew beads together. Arrange 3 faceted beads on center front of cluster. With sewing or beading needle and matching thread, sew beads in place. With sewing or beading needle and matching thread, sew one cylindrical bead in each space between crocheted beads around the outer edge of the cluster. With sewing needle and thread, sew jump-ring to top, center of cluster. Weave in any remaining ends. Thread jump-ring onto 18” (46 cm) silver chain.

SPECIAL STITCH
sc2tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

NOTES
1. Pendant is made from five crocheted beads that are sewn into a cluster. The cluster is then embellished with faceted and cylindrical glass beads.
2. Crocheted beads are worked in continuous rounds. Do not join and do not turn at the ends of rounds. A stitch marker can be used to indicate the end of rounds.
3. One end of each crocheted bead looks tidier than the other. Arrange beads into a cluster with the less tidy ends in the center of the cluster. The faceted beads, sewn to the center of the cluster will cover the less tidy ends.

CROCHETED BEADS (make 5)
Ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 2 sc in each ch around—6 sc. Place a marker (optional) in last stitch to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Rounds 3–5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sts.
Stuff bead with a pinch of fiberfill. Use blunt end of crochet hook, or something similar, to tamp stuffing in place.
Round 7: Sc2tog, [skip next st, slip st in next st] twice.
Fasten off. Weave in ends. Trim stray ends of fiberfill, if needed.

materials: RED HEART® Cordial™, Art E832 available in 3.5 oz (100 g), 62 yd (57 m) balls
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]; larger hook for foundation chain 10.00mm [US N-13]
measurements: Bracelet in small size: To fit wrist: 6” (7”, 8”). For larger wrists start with 2 extra chains for each inch (7” wrist, start with 18 chains; 8 inch wrist start with 20 chains). Two sizes are photographed together.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this pattern.
instructions: Using larger hook, make a slip knot and chain 16 (18, 20). Row 1: Double crochet in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across. Finish off, leaving an end. Using yarn needle, weave ends in securely.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Crochet Thread Classic™ 10 (Colors: 300 yds/274.32 m) Copper Mist (0310) 1 ball
Size U.S. 9 [1.25 mm] Susan Bates® steel crochet hook
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx ½" [1.25 cm] diameter, excluding earring wire.
gauge: Not specified
instructions:
Note: Earrings are worked in continuous rnds. Move marker as you work. See Diagrams on page 2.
Cat Head
Make magic ring.
1st rnd: 6 sc into magic ring. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th to 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Stuff lightly.
7th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. 12 sts.
8th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts.
Fasten off leaving long end. Weave long end through rem 6 sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Cat Ears (Make 2)
Ch 2.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 1 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in sc. 2 sc. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing to Cat Head.
Sew Ears to top of Head.
FINISHING
Attach jump ring to top behind Ears. Attach second jump ring to first jump ring.
Attach third jump ring to second jump ring, then attach to earring wire.
With embroidery Floss embroider whiskers and nose using straight stitch.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Baker’s Cotton: 1 ball each of 621 Green A, 565 Purple B, 529 Turquoise C, 900 Red D and 700 Pink E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.25 mm [US D-3]
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into specified stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Necklace measures 30” (76.2 cm) in circumference.
gauge: Large flower = 1½” (3.8 cm) in diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Notes
Necklace chain is made in one long piece, then arranged to form loops of different lengths. If a longer or shorter necklace is desired, make chain longer or shorter.
NECKLACE 
Chain
With A, make a ch 80” (203 cm) long, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; join with slip st in first slip st, making sure chain is not twisted. Fasten off A. Weave in ends.
Large Flower (make 16 total: 4 each with B, C, D, and E)
Round 1 (Right Side): Leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail, ch 3 (2nd and 3rd ch count as hdc), 9 hdc in 3rd ch from hook; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3 – 10 hdc.
Round 2: *(Ch 1, [dc, ch 2] 3 times) in next hdc (petal made)**, slip st in next hdc; repeat from * 3 more times; repeat from * to ** once; join with a slip st in first slip st – 5 petals. Fasten off. Weave in ending tail.
Small Flower (make 8 total: 2 each with B, C, D, and E)
Round 1 (Right Side): Leaving a 6” (15 cm) tail, ch 2, *(slip st, ch 2, dc, ch 2) in 2nd ch from hook (petal made); repeat from * 4 more times in same ch; join with slip st in first slip st – 5 petals. Fasten off. Weave in ending tail.
ASSEMBLY
On a flat surface, loop chain around to form 3 loops, 23” (58.5 cm), 27” (68.5 cm) and 30” (76 cm) in circumference. Pin top of loops together. Arrange half of flowers along 3 loops of chain, as shown in assembly diagram and photo, or as desired. Pin each flower to chain for placement. With center 6” (15 cm) tail, sew flowers to chain and buttons on right side of flowers. Repeat with other flowers of same size and buttons on opposite side of chain. If desired, sew chains together at top of necklace.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 226 Natural
Susan Bates® Steelite® Crochet Hook: 1.65mm [US 7 steel hook]
four 6mm brown and tan spectra glass beads (sample used Color Gallery by Bead Treasures model #987149)
two 8mm brown and tan spectra glass beads (sample used Color Gallery by Bead Treasures model #184911)
six 4mm lab topaz gem cut glass beads (sample used Color Gallery by Bead Treasures #648915)
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Earring measures 2½” long x 1¼” wide (6.5 x 3 cm), including earwire and large dangle.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
EARRING Flower (make 2)
Make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Beg-pop in ring, [ch 2, popcorn in ring] 5 times, ch 2; join with slip st in first popcorn—6 popcorns and 6 ch-2 spaces. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, *(hdc, dc, ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook (point made), ch 1, dc, hdc) in next ch-2 space, slip st in next popcorn; repeat from * around ending with last slip st in beginning ch—6 points. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block and lightly starch as needed.
Earwires With pliers, open loop of each earwire, insert through any point on each flower, then pinch loop closed. 
Large Dangle (make 2)
Place an 8mm bead on a headpin, then place a 4mm bead on the headpin. Leaving ½” (1.5 cm) above last bead, use wire cutter to cut off unused length of headpin. Insert headpin through point directly opposite earwire and pinch loop closed with pliers.
Small Dangle (make 4)
Make same as large dangle with 6mm beads in place of 8mm beads. Insert headpin through point on each side of large dangle and pinch loops closed with pliers.
Special Stitches
beg-pop (beginning popcorn) = Ch 2 (counts as dc), 3 dc in ring, drop loop from hook, insert hook from front to back in top of the beginning ch, place dropped loop back on hook and draw through.
popcorn = Work 4 dc in ring, drop loop from hook, insert hook from front to back in first dc of 4-dc group, place dropped loop back on hook and draw through.
Special Technique
Adjustable-ring method = Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail firmly between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work stitches of first round in the ring, working over both strands (the tail and the ring). After the first round of stitches is worked, pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.

materials: Red Heart® Soft: 1 ball each 4614 Black A and 4608 Wine B.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: One size fits most. Length including Ties: 21”.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
CHOKER
With A, ch 70. Fasten off.
Row 1: Skip 19 ch from one end, join B in next ch with sc, sc in next 31 ch – 32 sc.
Row 2: Turn, [ch 12, skip next 3 sc, slip st in next sc] across. Fasten off.
Round 3: Turn, holding previous ch-12 space to back, join A to 3rd sc on Row 1, *ch 12, skip 3 sc of Row 1, holding next ch-12 space to front, slip st in next sc, ch 12, skip next 3 sc of Row 1, holding next ch-7 space to back, slip st in sc; repeat from * to last 2 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Classic Crochet Thread,” Size 10: 1 Ball 419 Ecru.
20 ½” wooden beads, fiberfill, yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice; yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Dc5tog = [Yo and draw up a loop in indicated st, yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] 5 times; yo and draw through all 6 loops on hook.
measurements: Necklace is 70” long.
gauge: 1 Ball = ¾” x 1¼”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Before beginning to crochet, string wooden beads on thread. To position beads, work to indicated place, remove hook, insert hook through bead and back into last st, pull st through bead, push bead into place.

NECKLACE
Ch 6.
Ball-Round 1: 8 Sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st to 1st sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st, * 2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * to last st, 2 sc in last st; join – 12 sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st, * 2 sc in next st, 1 sc in next st; repeat from * to last st, 2 sc in last st; join – 18 sts.
Round 4: Ch 3 (counts as 1st dc), * dc in next st; repeat from * around; join.
Rounds 5-6: Repeat Round 4.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in same st, * sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from * to last 2 sts; sc2tog; join – 12 sts. Stuff with fiberfill.
Round 8: Repeat Round 7 – 8 sts. Add more fiberfill.
Round 9: Ch 1; [draw up a loop in next st] 5 times; yo and draw through all 6 loops on hook – sc5tog made; [draw up a loop in next st] 3 times, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook – sc3tog made; join with a slip st in middle of sc5tog.
Connector-Row 1: Ch 8, dc5 tog in 3rd ch from hook, ch 6, pull up a bead, dc5tog in 3rd ch from hook, ch 6.
Repeat Rounds 1-9 and Row 1 19 more times. Join to first st; fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all ends. Roll each Ball between hands to even out the stuffing and give them their final shape.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]; smaller hook to weave in ends 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle, two buttons ⅞” (22 mm)-JHB Streamline K924
measurements: Bracelet measures 8” long x 2” wide (20 x 5 cm). To fit wrist: 6” (15 cm) to 8” (20 cm)
gauge: 10 sc = 4” (10 cm); 12 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
BRACELET  
Leave a long 18” (45.7 cm) end and make a slip knot.
With larger hook, ch 21 loosely.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in 1st sc and in each sc across.
Rows 3 & 4: Repeat Row 2.
BUTTON LOOPS
Continuing with same yarn, ch 6, slip st in center of end; ch 6 and slip st in corner. 
With smaller hook, weave in ends.
Note: Photographed bracelet used yarn ends to sew buttons. 
To make it easier to insert into button holes, wrap ends with 
cellophane tape. If buttons do not have large enough holes, 
sew buttons on with sewing needle and thread. 
FINISHING
Mark location of buttons to fit wrist. With beginning yarn 
end, weave through stitches on wrong side and bring up 
where you want first button; sew button. Bring yarn up at 
second button location and sew button. Weave in ends.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.

instructions:
ROPE 1
Ch 40, [5 hdc in second ch from hook, slip st in first hdc,

ROPE 2
Ch 46, [5 hdc in second ch from hook, slip st in first hdc,

Ch 52, [5 hdc in second ch from hook, slip st in first hdc,

together. Knot ends.

with a slip st in first sc—6 petals. Fasten off. 
Weave in ends.
Round 8: With right side facing, join thread in 
center dc on any petal in Round 7 of Rose, ch 
1, sc in first st (place marker in this st to mark 
top edge of Motif), ch 8, (sc, ch 12, sc) in 
center dc of next petal, *ch 8, sc in center dc 
of next petal, ch 8, (sc, ch 12, sc) in center dc 
of next petal; repeat from * once, ch 6, hdc in 
first sc of round (counts as last ch-8 loop)—6 
ch-8 loops; 3 ch-12 loops at corners.
Round 9: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), (dc, ch 1, 
dc, ch 1, dc, ch 2) in next ch-8 space, *(tr, ch 
2, dc, ch 2, tr, ch 3, tr, ch 2, dc, ch 2, tr) in next 
ch-12 space, ch 2**, (dc, ch 1, dc, ch 1, dc, ch 
2) in each of next 2 ch-8 loops; repeat from *
around, ending last repeat at **, (dc, ch 1, dc,
ch 1) in last ch-8 space; join with a slip st in
3rd ch of beginning ch-5—12 ch-1 space;
18 ch-2 spaces; 3 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Motif Edging
Row 1: With wrong side facing, join thread in 
first ch-3 space on last corner to work down 
side of the Motif, ch 1, 2 sc in same space, 3 
sc in next ch-2 space, 2 sc in each of next 4 
ch spaces, 3 sc in next ch-2 space, 2 sc in 
each of next 5 ch spaces, 5 sc in next ch-3 
space, 2 sc in each of next 5 ch spaces, 3 sc

Special Stitches
4-dc popcorn: Work 4 dc in next st, drop loop
from hook insert hook in first st, draw dropped
loop through st on hook, ch 1 to lock the stitch.
3-dc popcorn: Work 3 dc in next st, drop loop
from hook insert hook in first st, draw dropped
loop through st on hook, ch 1 to lock the stitch.
shell: (3-dc popcorn, [dc, 3-dc popcorn] twice)
in same st.
small corkscrew: Ch 20, working in top loop
of ch sts, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 3 sc in
next 13 ch, slip st in next 5 ch.
large corkscrew: Ch 25, working in top loop
of ch sts, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 3 sc in
next 14 ch, slip st in next 9 ch.
picot: Ch 3, slip st in top of last sc made.

Round 5: Slip st in first ch-4 space, ch 1, (sc, 
7 dc, sc) in each ch-4 space around; join with 
a slip st in first sc—6 petals.
Round 6: Ch 1, working behind petals in 
Round 5, sc around the post of first sc in 
Round 5, ch 5, *sc around the post of next sc 
in Round 5

Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as tr), 4-dc popcorn in 
next sc, *dc in next sc, 4-dc popcorn in next 
sc*; repeat from * to * 12 times, (dc, 4-dc 
popcorn, dc) in next sc, 4-dc popcorn in next 
sc, repeat from * to * 13 times, tr in next sc, 
turn—29 popcorns; 28 dc; 2 tr.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each of first 29 sts, (2 sc, 
ch 2, 2 sc) in next popcorn, sc in each of next 
29 sts, turn—62 sc; 1 ch-2 space. Fasten off. 
Weave in ends. 
Necklace
First Side
Ch 90, with right side facing, slip st in first sc 
of Row 3 on Motif. Fasten off. 
Second Side
With wrong side facing, join thread in last sc 
of Row 3, ch 91.
Top Edging
Row 1: Working in top loop of each ch, sc in 
2nd ch from hook and in each ch across to 
Motif Edging, 3 sc in row-end tr in Row 2 of 
Motif Edging, 2 sc in next ch-3 corner space of 
Motif, 2 sc in each of next 3 ch-2 spaces, sc in 
each of next 5 ch-spaces, 2 sc in each of next 
3 ch-2 spaces, 2 sc in next ch-3 corner space 
of Motif, 3 sc in next row-end tr in Row 2 of 
Motif Edging, working in top loop only of each 
ch, sc in each of next 90 ch, turn—207 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2, dc in each of next 4 sc, *4-dc 
popcorn in next sc, dc in next sc; repeat from 
* across, turn—101 popcorn. Note: Necklace
will ripple after this row but will straighten out
on the next row.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each of first 89 sts, [skip
next popcorn, sc in next dc] twice; sc in each
of first 22 sts, [skip next popcorn, sc in next
dc] twice; sc in each st across—203 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc 
in first st, *skip next 2 sc, shell in next sc, 
skip next 2 sc**, sc in next sc, skip next 3 sc, 
shell in next sc, skip next 3 sc, sc in next sc; 
repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, 
3 sc in last sc, working across row-end sts 
of Necklace, work 5 sc in row-end dc of Row 
2, skip next next row-end sc, sc in ch at base 
of sc, ch 7 (for button loop), turn, skip next 7 
sc, sc in next sc, slip st in next sc, ch 1, turn, 
work 12 sc in next ch-7 space, 2 sc in first ch 
already holding a sc—29 shells; plus button 
loop. Do not fasten off.
Lower Edging
Row 1: Working in the remaining 2 loops of 
ch sts, sc in each of next 4 ch, *skip next 2 
ch, shell in next ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 
ch *; repeat from * to * 13 times, skip next 
ch, working in back loops of sts on Motif 
edge, skip next sc, **(3-dc popcorn, dc, 3-dc 
popcorn, small corkscrew, dc, 3-dc popcorn) 
in next sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc**; 
repeat from ** to ** 4 times, skip next 2 sc, 
[3-dc popcorn, dc] twice in next ch-2 space, 
3-dc popcorn in same ch-2 space (without
working ch 1), (small corkscrew, slip st, large 
corkscrew, slip st, small corkscrew, slip st) in 
back of last popcorn made, [dc, 3-dc popcorn] 
twice in same ch-2 space; repeat from ** to ** 
5 times, skip next sc, skip next ch, working in 
the remaining 2 loops of ch sts; repeat from * 
to * across. Fasten off. Weave in ends. 
Center Corkscrew Embellishment (make 1) 
Ch 9, working in top loop of ch sts, 3 sc in 2nd 
ch from hook, 3 sc in each of next 5 ch, slip 
st in each of next 3 ch. Fasten off, leaving a 6” 
(15 cm) sewing length. 
Side Corkscrew Embellishment (make 4) 
Ch 7, working in top loop of ch sts, 3 sc in 2nd 
ch from hook, 3 sc in each of next 5 ch, slip 
st in next ch. Fasten off, leaving a 6” (15 cm) 
sewing length.  
Leaves (make 4) 
Round 1: Ch 8, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc 
in next ch, dc in next ch, 3 dc in next ch, dc in 
next ch, hdc in next ch, (2 sc, picot, sc) in next 
ch, working across opposite side of foundation 
ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, 3 dc in next 
ch, dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next ch, 
slip st in first sc, ch 3. Fasten off, leaving a 6” 
(15 cm) sewing length.  
FINISHING 
Arrange Leaves and Corkscrew 
Embellishments as desired around lower edge 
of Rose, tucking them up between the 2nd 
and 3rd layers of petals of Rose. Using the 
sewing lengths, sew in place. With sewing 
needle and thread sew button on end of 
necklace opposite button loop.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Crochet Thread Classic™ 10 (White & Natural: 400 yds/365.76 m, Colors: 300 yds/274.32 m)
Size U.S. 9 [1.25 mm] Susan Bates® steel crochet hook
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx ½" [1.25 cm] diameter of each Sphere. Approx 2" [5 cm] long, excluding earring wire.
gauge: Gauge not specified.
instructions:
Sphere (Make 6 – 2 of each color)
See Diagram on page 2.
Make magic ring.
1st rnd: 6 sc into magic ring. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th to 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Stuff lightly.
7th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. 12 sts.
8th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts.
Fasten off leaving long end. Weave long end through rem 6 sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
FINISHING
Attach jump ring to top and bottom of spheres of A and B. Attach jump ring to top only on C. Using top jump ring, attach A to earring wire, then attach the top of B to the bottom of A. Attach the top of C to the bottom of B.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® “Classic Crochet”: 1 ball 15 Shaded Pinks
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: One size fits most.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
MOTIFS
Small Flower
Ch 6, slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3), [dc in ring, ch 3] 5 times, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch to join – 6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: [Sc, hdc, 3 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-3 space around – 6 petals.
Round 3: Working in back of work, slip st around post of first dc on Round 1, *ch 5, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 5, slip st in first st – 6 ch-5 spaces.
Round 4: [Sc, hdc, 5 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-5 space around – 6 petals.
Round 5: Working in back of work, slip st around post of first dc on Round 1, *ch 7, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 7, slip st in first st – 6 ch-7 spaces.
Round 6: [Sc, hdc, 7 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-7 space around – 6 petals.
Fasten off.
Large Flower
Thread 30 beads onto working thread. Ch 6, slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3), [dc in ring, ch 3] 5 times, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch to join – 6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: [Sc, hdc, 2 dc, slip 1 bead close to hook, dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-3 space around – 6 petals.
Round 3: Working in back of work, slip st around post of first dc on Round 1, *ch 5, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 5, slip st in first st – 6 ch-5 spaces.
Round 4: [Sc, hdc, 3 dc, slip 1 bead close to hook, 2 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-5 space around – 6 petals.
Round 5: Working in back of work, slip st around post of first dc on Round 1, *ch 7, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 7, slip st in first st – 6 ch-7 spaces.
Round 6: [Sc, hdc, 4 dc, slip 1 bead close to hook, 3 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-7 space around – 6 petals.
Round 7: Working in back of work, slip st around post of first dc on Round 1, *ch 9, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 9, slip st in first st – 6 ch-9 spaces.
Round 8: [Sc, hdc, 5 dc, slip 1 bead close to hook, 4 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-9 space around – 6 petals.
Round 9: Working in back of work, slip st around post of first dc on Round 1, *ch 11, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 11, slip st in first st – 6 ch-11 spaces.
Round 10: [Sc, hdc, 6 dc, slip 1 bead close to hook, 5 dc, hdc, sc] in each ch-11 space around – 6 petals.
Fasten off.
EARRINGS
(Make 2)
Make Small Flower but do not fasten off, slip st around post of dc on Round 1, ch 5, slip st in earring ring, ch 5, slip st around post of next dc on Round 1.
Fasten off.
NECKLACE
(Make 4 Small Flowers and one Large Flower)
Slip st into spring ring, ch 132, slip st into jump ring.
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, turn, skip 1 ch, sc in each ch across – 131 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, sc in each sc across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in 4 sc, [sc in 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 24 times, sc in last 7 sts – 155 sts.
Row 4: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 3), turn, skip next st, dc in next st, [ch 3, skip next st, dc in next st] across. Mark center dc.
Row 5: Ch 2, turn, [2 sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2] across to last ch-3 space, 3 sc in last ch-3 space. Mark 2nd, 5th and 8th ch-2 space on either side of center dc for Flower placement.
Row 6: Ch 3, turn, [3 dc, picot in next ch-2 space] across to first marked ch-2 space, 2 dc in ch-2 space, slip st in center st of one petal of first Small Flower, dc in same ch-2 space, (picot, 3 dc, picot) in next ch-2 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 5, slip st in center st of next petal to left of same Small Flower, slip st in center st of one petal of next Small Flower, dc in same ch-2 space, (picot, 3 dc, picot) in next ch-2 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 5, slip st in center st of next petal to left of same Small Flower, slip st in center st of one petal of next Large Flower, dc in same ch-2 space, (picot, 3 dc, picot) in next ch-2 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, slip st in center st of next petal to left of same Large Flower, slip st in marked center dc, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, (picot, 3 dc, picot) in next ch-2 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 5, slip st in center st of next petal to left of same Large Flower, [slip st in center st of one petal of next Small Flower, dc in same ch-2 space, (picot, 3 dc, picot) in next ch-2 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 5, slip st in center st of next petal to left of same Small Flower] twice, [3 dc, picot in next ch-2 space] across to last ch-2 space, 4 dc in last ch-2 space.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

Round 4: Ch 1, sc in space made by dc, ch 5, *sc in next ch-4 space, ch 2, ch-4 picot, ch 2, picot corner in next ch-5 space, ch 2, ch-4 picot, ch 2, sc in next ch-4 space**, ch 5; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends and block to final measurements. Following manufacturer’s instructions, attach jump rings to 2 ch-4 picots on either side of any picot corner as shown. Attach jump rings to chain. Attach clasp to back of chain.

instructions:
TODDLER NECKLACE 
With A, ch 150. Fasten off.
String on 7 beads, move them to center of chain, leaving space for Tassels. 
Make 2 tassels each with A and D. Tie 2 A tassels and 2 D tassels in between beads. Weave tie ends back into tassels. 
Trim ends.

CHILD NECKLACE 
With C, ch 50, place first marker, ch 50, place second marker, ch 51, turn, slip st in 2nd st from hook and in each ch to second marker. String on wood beads 8-10" [20-25 cm] from starting end of chain. Remove and replace markers as needed to string beads. Chain 90, skip center section, slip st in next ch at first marker and each ch to beginning. 
Fasten off.

ADULT NECKLACE 
With G, ch 55, place first marker, ch 40, place second marker, ch 56, turn, slip st in 2nd st from hook and each ch to end, ch 60, working on 40 sts between first and second marker, sc in first 16 sts, picot, hdc in next st, picot, dc in next st, picot, tr in next st, dtr in next st, picot, dtr in next st, picot, tr in next st, picot, dc in next st, picot, hdc in next st, picot, sc in next 16 sts to second marker, ch 100. Fasten off, leaving beginning and ending chain hanging. 
String 6 wood beads on ch-60 section, tie hanging end of ch-60 to necklace at second marker. Make 2 pompoms each with E and F and 1 pompom with B. Tie pompoms on to ch-60 section between beads in the following color order: E, F, B, F, E. After tying on pompoms, weave ends of tie back through pompom. Trim ends.
String 9 wood beads on ch-100 section, tie hanging end of ch-100 to necklace at first marker.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Fashion Crochet size 3: 1 ball each 365 Coffee A and 65 Warm Teal B
60 size 2/0 E-beads for each bracelet (samples used Beader’s Paradise 2/0 Czech Glass E-Beads in Topaz and Copper Mix)
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Bracelet measures 191⁄2” (46.8cm) long.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com ©2014 Coats & Clark RedHeart.com Page 1 of 1 Easy Beaded Bracelets These beaded wrapped bracelets are fun to wear and cool to crochet! Using beads and thicker size 3 crochet thread, it’s easy to become your own jewelry maker. Photo shows two bracelets on worn together. Special Stitches bch (beaded chain) = Slide bead close to hook, yarn over and draw through loop on hook. 3bch (3 bead chain) = Slide 3 beads close to hook, yarn over and draw through loop on hook. Notes 1. Beads are strung on thread before you begin crocheting. 2. Allow beads to fall close to ball and slide each bead close to hook as you need it. BRACELET (make 1 with A and topaz beads and 1 with B and copper mix beads) String 60 beads onto thread. Ch 119. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, [bch, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 57 times, sc in last 2 ch, 3bch, slip st in side of last sc made, 2 slip st in space under 3-bead group (clasp made), turn—61 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, slip st in each sc and ch across to last sc, slip st in last sc, ch 5, slip st in side of same sc (loop made). Fasten off. FINISHING Weave in ends. To wear, wrap 3 times around wrist and insert clasp into loop to close bracelet.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 536 Passionata
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Earring measures 1¾” (4.5 cm) long, including hoop.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
EARRING (make 2)
Row 1 (right side): Join yarn with slip st in hoop, sc in hoop—1 sc. Do not turn.
Row 2:
Forward Pass: Insert hook in sc, pull up a loop, slip st in hoop—3 loops on hook. 
Return Pass: [Yo, draw through 2 loops] twice—3 Tss.
Row 3:
Forward Pass: Tss, insert hook in slip st, pull up a loop (3 loops on hook), slip st in hoop—4 loops on hook.
Return Pass: [Yo, draw through 2 loops] across—4 Tss.
Row 4:
Forward Pass: Tss across to slip st, insert hook in slip st, pull up a loop, slip st in hoop—5 loops on hook.
Return Pass: [Yo, draw through 2 loops] across—5 Tss.
Rows 5–10: Repeat Row 4 Forward Pass and Return Pass—11 Tss.
Row 11: Bind off across to slip st, slip st in slip st, insert hook in hoop, pull up a loop and draw through loop on hook. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block each earring, pinning out bottom point.
Notes
1. An afghan hook is not necessary for this project.
2. Tunisian crochet is worked from the right side only; do not turn at the end of a row.
3. Each Tunisian simple stitch row consists of a forward pass and a reverse pass. Always skip the first vertical bar when working the Forward Pass. Insert the hook in the second vertical bar at the beginning of the row. Loops remain on the hook in the Forward Pass and are worked off the hook in the Reverse Pass.
4. All loops on hook in Forward Pass count as Tunisian simple stitches.
5. If you hold the hook in your right hand, you will work the forward pass, picking up loops, from right to left. And you will work the return pass, working off loops, from left to right. If you hold the hook in your left hand, you will work the forward and return passes in the opposite directions.
6. When making the 2nd earring, hold the earring hoop so the clasp faces the opposite direction.
7. To make a larger earring, repeat Row 4 as many times as desired. You may need a larger hoop.
Special Stitches
Tunisian simple stitch (Tss) = Working from right to left, holding working yarn behind work, insert hook under next vertical bar, yarn over and draw up a loop. 
Slip stitch in hoop (slip st in hoop) = Insert hook in hoop, yarn over and pull up a loop.
Bind off = insert hook in next vertical bar, yarn over, draw through both loops on hook.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Earrings measure 2” across.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
EArrinG (Make 2)
round 1: Ch 3 (counts as hdc), work 7 hdc in 3rd ch from hook, slip st in first hdc to join – 8 hdc.
round 2: Ch 9, sc in next hdc, [ch 8, sc in next hdc] 7 times, slip st in first ch – 8 ch-8 spaces.
round 3: Slip st in next 4 ch, *ch 5, sc in 5th ch of next ch-8 space; repeat from * around, slip st to first ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FiniSHinG
Thread 15 seed beads on long tail. Keeping beads close to last round, sew end of long tail to last round of Earring to secure beads in place. Sew Earring hook on opposite side of Earring. Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic 10: 1 ball each 421 Goldenrod A, 431 Pumpkin B, and 001 White C
two antique brass fishhook earring wires
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Earring measures 6⁄8” (2 cm) x 2” (5 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
EARRING (Make 2)
Candy Corn Motif (Make 4)
With A, ch 8.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; ch 1, turn – 7 sc.
Row 2: Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog, changing to B in last st; ch 3, turn – 5 sc.
Fasten off A, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Row 3: Dc in each st across; ch 1, turn.
Row 4: Sc in each st across, changing to C in last st; ch 1, turn.
Fasten off B, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Row 5: Sc2tog, sc in next st, sc2tog; ch 1, turn – 3 sc.
Row 6: Sc3tog. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Weave in all ends except long sewing ends on Wrong Side.
FINISHING
To assemble, lay 2 motifs Wrong Sides together. Whipstitch motifs together, matching thread color to stitch color. Weave in ends.
Mist with water and pin to dry if desired.
Using photo as a guide, sew candy corn onto earring wire through bead with A.
